text: Phakth is pleased with his tribute. As the knife strikes home and the Norscan exhales his last, a glow suffuses Settra's troop, and a bright beam pierces the firmament, highlighting a point of land far-distant. A Liche Priest produces a map and marks the destination.

The Liche Priests bend to their work. As the Norscan is swiftly denuded, he babbles the source of his wealth: Ice Tooth Mountain. His outsize skeleton is soon back on its feet, an impressive specimen indeed. Settra commands it to lead the way to his crown's resting-place.

As the agent descends into the tomb, the sounds of battle ring out. A band of Lizardmen is locked in mortal combat with a host of crypt-horrors, and they are losing. As the Undead begin to overwhelm the reptiles, the agent spots a standard-bearer scurrying for the entrance with a clanking sack of relics on his back. He slays the creature and takes the trove. Surveying the limits of the chamber, he also realises that Alcadizaar's sarcophagus is missing. Hefting the sack, he exits the tomb and sets out to rendezvous with Arkhan.

The agent hovers at the entrance until the clamour dies down, then steals inside to witness a scene of devastation. Lizardmen corpses litter the main chamber, but the Crypt Horrors have returned to their swaying, quiescent state. Sensing some kinship with the agent perhaps, they do not attack, but point mournfully toward an alcove where clearly a fine sarcophagus once lay. Alcadizaar's coffin has been spirited away. Tearing a symbol from the tunic of a dead Lizardman, your agent sets out to bring Arkhan the news. \\n\\n Arkhan is beside himself with anger. What could the perfidious Lizardmen want with Alcadizaar's remains? He smells some species of dark scheme afoot, and demands the Liche Priests bring him news of these interlopers. Through divine communion, the Scavenger-God Ualatp reveals to them the location of the looters. Arkhan wastes no time, and sets out with his army to wrest Alcadizaar's remains from the Lizardmen.

Now that the Books of Nagash are in your grasp, the Great Necromancer’s immense source of power is yours to wield. On the battlefield, your enemies will wither and die before your unstoppable legions. To battle – to conquest, in life, death, Unlife and beyond!

Uttering the dark litanies contained with the third Book of Nagash has caused a furious, swirling sandstorm to come into existence. Now it threatens to consume all in its path – even the Liche Priests’ death magic cannot hold back the savagery of the elements this time!

Bretonnian crusaders have returned home bearing the remains of King Amanhotep at the head of their army, foolishly believing him to be one of their own nobles. Upon his awakening, the Tomb King slaughtered entire towns before returning to his rest. We should capitalise on the disorder and use this opportunity to strike!

Those half-sized men have devised a primitive yet highly-effective weapon. The pots of fiery liquid thrown at our forces burn through both armour and bones alike - we should be weary of this strange, new technology.

A wondrous cache of arrows has been discovered, brimming with the power of Asaph, the Goddess of Beauty, Magic and Vengeance! We should arm our archers with this blessed ordnance and send our enemies a rain of death!
Our Liche Priests have seen into the wondrous Realm of Souls, but report that what they have seen there is not what we were promised; ruins and decay plague their visions. Perhaps this is a warning?

Whilst travelling through Lustria's jungles, one of our regiments has been attacked by a band of warrior-women who moved silently through the trees before disappearing again as swiftly as they appeared. We should proceed with caution.

Rapid expansion combined with heavy precipitation has turned the ground surrounding our city walls to quicksand; anyone who passes over it is swallowed by the desert! Although such a thing cannot harm the Unliving, our enemies will struggle to fight us as they are slowly consumed by the sands!

Their sad lament over lifetimes spent and lost has driven our Undead Lords into a furious frenzy! In an effort to quell the feelings of anger and loss, many of their servants are set to work performing tasks that only the living need undertake.

There is talk of entire armies who fight without a cause of their own, instead offering their services in return for payment in gold! Such soldiers cannot be trusted - we must ensure they are not used against us!

Up in the mountains, a volcano has erupted, raining molten fire down on our army. Many units have been reduced to ashes amongst the sand - we should move quickly yet cautiously through this infernal land!

Our scouts have located a vast graveyard containing the graves of many fine warhorses. The bones are well preserved and may still be strong enough to serve us - we should raise these creatures from their slumber to strengthen our cavalry even further.

A rumour has reached us, from far across the sea, that a Vampire has located a chamber of untold power, deep within Lustria. Although he failed to harvest its power for his own Unliving ends, the chamber collapsed, releasing the magic trapped within!

Whilst excavating the Tomb City of Lybaras, our slave workers have uncovered scrolls detailing tactics, formations and manoeuvres not used for hundreds of years. There is much to be learned from this ancient way of battle - our enemies will be surprised when they die!

Your allies have taken the Phoenix Gate. A valiant act, even if it deprives Avelorn of a righteous victory. Desperate not to offend the Everqueen, they have sent the reclaimed Shieldstone of Isha to your court in order to soothe any diplomatic wrinkles. After all, the Shieldstone belongs in your care.
Death Night fades from the memories of those that serve you. Take these slaves as a gift; call another Death Night, so all may bathe in its destructive glory.
The queen returns to defend Ulthuan. Her presence bolsters your soldiers - no amount of Druchii armour could defend against them!

In Har Ganeth, the Dark Elf desire for murder and blood is kept in abeyance by the strictest of laws in Naggaroth. Only on Death Night are these laws put on hold and the Druchii permitted to unleash their true instincts. Bloody excess and wanton slaughter flood the boulevards and plazas, all under Hellebron’s intense gaze - tonight is Death Night!\\n\\nHellebron will meet the dawn revitalised and strong from the night’s bloody orgy, although over time she will wither once more. In the Death Night’s aftermath her followers are sated, their murderous impulses gratified for now.

In the Death Night’s aftermath her followers are sated, their murderous impulses gratified for now.
As Chaos corruption recedes from Avelorn's lands Alarielle begins to grow stronger; emboldened once more she can now return to her former strength.

As Chaos corruption sweeps over the lands of Avelorn like an inevitable wave, Alarielle begins to grow weaker. Surely now she must begin to look elsewhere for help, perhaps only nature itself can help her make one last stand?

The Blood Voyage has met its end. As expected, it is only in death that these blood-crazed murderers ceased their quest for murder. With their last breaths, their victims must have lamented their very existence, but to you their madness is nothing but a benefit - the loot they accumulated from battle now passes on to you.

The Dark Elf merchant is suspiciously pleased to receive the Norse, venturing that he will be a willing buyer should they retrieve the corpse of the 'Mother of the Flame'. He points to the extinguished pinion that is sat upon a dais guarded by two Druchii warriors. He cautions that this will be no easy hunt. Legend has it, the Phoenix is a creature of Hekarti, existing between the mortal plane and in the Realm of Chaos. It only makes its appearance on the side of the mortal veil rarely, once a century at most. It is 'awoken' into this world through the heart of a burning volcano.\\n\\nAccording to the Dark Elf, that is the time to strike. They are vulnerable during those early moments of awakening, but will quickly gain strength and become deadly and all but impervious to attack.

The deed is done - the head of the merchant's rival is brought to you, and so you cast it down to the feet of the Druchii. He smiles and reveals the Mother of the Flame will next appear from Vaul's Anvil. He hands over the pinion and ushers you away. Before leaving, you wish the information to be 'certified'; you call over your thralls and they approach the merchant with thirsty smiles on their faces. the Ice Wolves make short work of his bodyguards...

The only pacts you make are with the Dark Gods themselves. Flay this petty broker, and take what you need without paying a thing!\\n\\nThe Druchii is fast and jumps out of his seat before you can grab him, but your Ice Wolves have an eye for fast prey and quickly clamp his soft throat in one of their jaws. His bodyguards are quickly - painfully - put to the sword. Naturally, the Dark Elf wretch tells all you need to know; Vaul's Anvil is where the Mother of the Flame is due to be reborn. You don't even flinch at the wet crack as the Ice Wolf bites through his spinal cord.\\n\\nYour reputation with other Dark Elves will surely be damaged by such an aggressive act, but all you care about is the hunt!

While the slavers of the Point are some of the meanest and cruellest men upon Lustria's coast, even they pale to the  mighty Norse Chieftains. The merchants grovel at your feet, desperate to appease you and your retinue out of a pathetic fear of what will happen if they earn your displeasure. Gold is given as tribute.\\n\\nAt first they draw a blank on a willing guide - they are coast-huggers who rarely venture into the jungle interior. Then, one of the slave-masters dares make a suggestion. He leads you to a cage, in which a small reptile with a blue crest hisses defiantly. The locals call it a Skink and claim that with the right amount of 'persuasion' it will lead you to your quarry.
Within the shrine, the Altar of Khaine has finally been consecrated - the Sword of Khaine is ready to receive a new owner!
Another makes a claim on the Sword of Khaine. Rituals of consecration are under way - soon the sword will fall into enemy hands!
The power of Khaine is yours to wield - you are in possession of the Sword of Khaine!
The Sword of Khaine has been claimed by another. Doom stalks the world once more, unless you can wrest it from them!

The Shrine of Khaine is yours now. Within sleeps Widowmaker, Aenarion's bane and the God of Murder's own blade. Consecrate the area by building the Altar of Khaine and the power will be yours to wield!
The Sword of Khaine has been returned to its shrine. Cataclysm has been narrowly avoided… for now.
The Sword of Khaine has fully merged with its current wielder. The weapon will not be relinquished unless taken from its owner's corpse.

One of Luthor’s more extreme personalities has temporarily seized control of his shattered mind, granting him some temporary effects. It may not be long until another personality takes over, however...

One of Luthor’s more extreme personalities has temporarily seized control of his shattered mind, granting him the use of a spell for a short time. It may not be long until another personality takes over, however...
The sound of the bickering voices in Luthor’s head have been momentarily silenced, allowing him to regain some of his old powers – at least for now.

One of Luthor’s more extreme personalities has temporarily seized control of his shattered mind, granting him some temporary effects. It may not be long until another personality takes over, however...

One of Luthor’s more extreme personalities has temporarily seized control of his shattered mind, granting him the use of a spell for a short time. It may not be long until another personality takes over, however...

Having long-sought the means to regain his former spellcasting abilities, Luthor’s desire to repair his damaged mind has finally been realised. For years, the mental instabilities caused by his multiple personalities have prevented him from wielding the Winds of Magic, but no more – the Lore of the Deep eludes him no longer!\\n\\nAll shall fear the Pirate King more than they ever have before!

Learnin' that our enemies 'ad equipped 'emselves with state-of-the-art weaponry, we of course set about taking it from 'em wiv haste. One lightnin' raid later an' it is we who now 'ave the advantage - yarrr!

It would seem that many of the local inhabitants are uncomfortable livin' under laws decreed an' enforced by Unlivin' masters. This matter is pressing, as many of these malcontents - these 'malfeasants' - now feel they can air such sedition publicly.

The winds are certainly provin' favourable this season, as we've been sailing at beam reach for days now. No matter our heading, we sail fast an' smooth. I think the Sea-God is at our backs - in fact, I'm sure of it!

Who're these useless cowards? Our enemies 'ave deployed a company of mercenaries to protect their merchants - the poor flowers - from our attentions; fortunately, they're a most ineffective rabble. Raiding 'as become very profitable as a result…

Our new citizens are not entirely pleased, it would appear. Governance by an Unlivin' force is not sittin' entirely well wiv many among the populace - many of whom are living in a state of constant fear an' dread. Due to this, mass migration is now occurrin'.
The Winds of Magic swell, so we bathe in their glorious, elemental hues an' bask in the power they imbue. However, it would be wise to note that too much power is invariably difficult to control…

The flora found 'ere conceals our army completely, like a thick, winter cloak of leaves an' branches which shield our movements from the enemy. The unsuspectin' foe will enjoy no warning afore we strike!

The extreme humidity 'round 'ere has negatively impacted our army - the rate at which our troops are decomposin' has greatly increased as a result. One has to wonder how much longer they can continue in this climate!
It's not necessary to expend too much effort when raising 'alf-buried corpses such as these; refillin' the ranks 'as never been so easy. Rissssssssse, me 'earties! Risssssssssse!
Our agents 'ave managed to acquire plans an' schematics detailin' all sorts of interesting new advancements our enemies are developin', 'indering their research efforts but greatly aiding our own.
Shyish blows so strongly in this area that our army 'as been reinforced with the deepest essence o'magic. For the time being at least, it'll be far easier to control.
Though we're certain that the abilities of our agents far exceed those of the pathetic mortals ranged against us, it's time we gave 'em a chance to prove their skill in anger.
The deckhands were diggin’ all through the night, ‘til their rusty spades clanked against an old chest buried in the dirt. The treasure has been found!
Your Infamy has increased; now your reputation truly walks before you!
Your Infamy has increased; now your reputation truly walks before you!
Your Infamy has increased; now your reputation truly walks before you!
Your Infamy has increased; now your reputation truly walks before you!

One o’ your cronies ‘as sent an intriguing message, cap’n! It seems there be a mysterious pirate shadowin’ our movements, passin’ through the taverns along the coasts n’ askin’ suspicious questions, in no friendly terms! We'd best stay vigilant…
Shiver me timbers! You've secured one of the verses of the Lost Sea Shanty!
Shiver me timbers! You've secured one of the verses of the Lost Sea Shanty!
Shiver me timbers! You've secured one of the verses of the Lost Sea Shanty!

The wind was in her favour and now she had a new pet! Captain Saltspite unleashed a rare laugh as the Swordfysh effortlessly glided through the waves. She was more than a mere pirate now, but a governess of many ports and richer than most Tilean princes. Maybe she should have shunned the living long ago?\\n\\nIt’s true that at first she had abhorred the Vampires and their zombie thralls on her ship, and only tolerated it due to the Seafather’s commandment. Yet, as they had slowly replaced the living and brought her victory after victory, Saltspite grew less concerned. Now she struggled to remember when she had last spoken to someone with breath and not seawater in their lungs.\\n\\nWho needs friends when you have power? That is what her uncle had told her anyway… for, of late, Manann spoke to her less and less. But there was another who filled that void; this one spoke of storms and sharks, and glorified her as the ultimate predator. He would take care of his niece and together they would rule the waves.

All the world is a stage and Cylostra had given her ultimate performance. Her prize, the Merwyrm of the High Elves, Amanar. Good! They stole her life, so she took from them Lothern’s guardian. Yet now their precious Vortex quivers, Ulthuan shall sink and she will sing to the Phoenix King as he chokes on seawater!\\n\\nBathing in the adoration of her mindless, groaning crew, she was temporarily oblivious when a visitor appeared upon the deck of the Lamprey. It was a thing of rags, incorporeal and long-dead.\\n\\n"Enchantress," it whispered in greeting with an unearthly hiss. Cylostra flexed her flabellum to hide her face.\\n\\n"Who addresses Madame-Captain Direfin?" she asked in her most self-important voice. \\n\\n"I come at the behest of my master," said the ghostly emissary. "He asks if you desire a return to Bretonnia? Where he has been working against the living for some time and could use a spirit of such prodigious talent."\\n\\nThe Madame-Captain inspected her silvery form in the mirror as she considered a response.\\n\\n"A patron," she mused. "And who is it that shows such interest in moi?"\\n\\n"Like you, mistress, he is an Enchanter, and a great one no less. He has gone under many names over the centuries. At this time, he is only known as 'The Nameless'."

It was done. The Merwyrm was slain by the empowered Star-metal Harpoon; a testament to the monster-killing lineage of the Wulfharts. Now the beast was resurrected and in thrall to Harkon, the Vampire Coast would expand and Luthor would be a force in the wider world once more.\\n\\nThis was no mere idle boast, for his mind had finally begun to align - the choir in his head would still bicker and rage on occasion, but were held in awe to a new voice, one that spoke with the wisdom of eons, as if it was older than Harkon even. It promised to guide Luthor and bring about an Undead empires to dwarf the current pretenders, especially the petty vassal-fiefdom of the von Carsteins. And when all that was achieved, the voice swore Harkon would be worthy of the greatest prize - to be at the right hand of a new Death-God… to be a Mortarch. \\n\\nLuthor Harkon will not be on the periphery when the End Times come!

Stood upon the deck of the Bloody Reaver, Count Noctilus looked out across the sea. If he were still living, he may have taken a deep breath, but those days of heartbeats and warm blood were long gone. Nevertheless, still cursed with a mortal’s desires, Noctilus could not hide his pleasure. Amanar was his; a gargantuan corpse enthused with Necromantic energy to wield against his foes.\\n\\nHe would continue to expand his network of coves and burgeoning empire outwards from the Galleon’s Graveyard, for there was still much power to be sought. Let the other fools battle for the Vortex, he would feed the skull-strewn Maelstrom with soul-power, and when it was ready, he would sail the Bloody Reaver into it. Then the Count could ply the seas of time, go anywhere or any-when; it was the ancestors of Jaego Roth who had the most to fear, for he would hunt them all down. History itself will not be safe from Nyklaus von Carstein!

You waited for the rival salvagers to leave, after which you sent your crew in to take a closer look at the sea beast’s remains. The majority of the loot had already been taken, but fortunately there were a few small sacks of gold left behind to make it worth your effort. These pirates may be greedy and opportunistic, but they weren’t very thorough!

Knowing that other, more unsavoury individuals may also be drawn to the monster’s valuable carcass, you delayed sending in your own small salvage party. When you eventually sent them a few days later they found that the majority of the loot had already been extracted from the beast’s belly, but fortunately there were a few small sacks of gold left behind to make it worth your effort.

Having decided to wait to discover the fate of the convoy’s wreckage, you eventually receive word that several deadly sea battles took place at the site. Allegedly, very few ships managed to get in and out of the area with anything of any value without being set upon by murderous rivals. In the ensuing chaos, most of the loot ended up at the bottom of the ocean, but your scouts in the area still managed to recover a few valuables from the site.

Having given the order to briefly drop anchor, it is not long before you observed an Empire ship opportunistically approaching the partially-submerged pirate galleon. The Empire troops started to unload items back onto their ship, but before you could order an interception, they were suddenly engulfed by a large, sulphurous explosion. The pirate shipwreck, now in a million pieces, was booby-trapped! You gathered what paltry bits of loot you could find floating nearby and hastily left the area.

You are no fool – you'd heard such songs before – they were clearly the work of Syreens, the hated Banshees of the sea. You later sent in a smaller expedition to extract whatever wealth could be found, but only a few of them returned after being attacked by a large mob of Zombie pirates. Fortunately, a bit of loot was recovered by those who survived and made it back.

Fortunately, a bit of loot was recovered by those who survived and made it back.

You are no fool – you'd heard such songs before – they were clearly the work of Syreens, the hated Banshees of the sea. You later sent in a smaller expedition to extract whatever wealth could be found, but only a few of them returned after being attacked by a large mob of Zombie pirates. Fortunately, a bit of loot was recovered by those who survived and made it back.

Deciding to first find out more about the island, you ordered your ship to drop anchor. When you eventually sent a small salvage party into the island a few days later, they were quickly attacked and almost wiped out by a large mob of Zombie pirates. Fortunately, a bit of loot was recovered from the island by the few who made it back, but before you could send a larger salvage crew back in, the mysterious island disappeared completely.

Deciding to first find out more about the island, you ordered your ship to drop anchor. When you eventually sent a small salvage party into the island a few days later, they were quickly attacked and almost wiped out by a large mob of Zombie pirates. Fortunately, a bit of loot was recovered from the island by the few who made it back, but before you could send a larger salvage crew back in, the mysterious island disappeared completely.

Deciding to wait for the pirates to leave the area, you dropped anchor a safe distance from the cove behind some neighbouring islets. After the black ship departed, you led your troops into the cold, damp enclosure, where you managed to find a few sacks of loot, but most of it had been taken away in the black ship. No risk, little reward!

The mighty Venerable Lord Kroak stirs from his deep slumber, his power so great that even death could not hold back his commitment to the Great Plan. Seek him out, for his support is invaluable.

With all parts now researched in the Forbidden Workshop, our Doomwheels have reached their maximum potential. A new, specialised Doomwheel unit has been successfully prototyped and is now available for recruitment as a free Regiment of Renown.

With all parts now researched in the Forbidden Workshop, our Doom-flayers have reached their maximum potential. A new, specialised Doom-flayers unit has been successfully prototyped and is now available for recruitment as a free Regiment of Renown.

With all parts now researched in the Forbidden Workshop, our Weapons Teams have reached their maximum potential. New, specialised Weapons Team units have been successfully field-tested and are now available for recruitment as free Regiments of Renown.

The consecutive research of different workshop parts and upgrades has born fruit. Your Warlock Engineers have therefore been able to put the accumulated knowledge towards the building of a new contraption.

All your efforts of gathering specimens and field data, whether or not by questionable means, have not been wasted - the Forbidden Workshop has now been upgraded!\\n\\nThe new Engineering Bay's advanced equipment and facilities now enable the research of new parts.

The growing intellects and egos of Skryre’s Warlock Engineers have necessitated that the laboratory facilities are expanded - the Forbidden Workshop has now been upgraded!\\n\\nThe new Warptech Lab is equipped with the best possible equipment and facilities available, enabling the research of more advanced parts.

Through the building and field-testing of myriad weapons (and the burning of millions of pitiful victims), you have gained an unequalled knowledge of martial technologies - the Forbidden Workshop has now been upgraded!\\n\\nIn the laboratories of the Great Warpforge, even the secrets of energy, space, and time are seemingly at your call, and the rules of physics manipulated at your whim for the purposes of forging destruction and murder. Further part upgrades are now available!

Your Imperial Authority has sunk too low; considering yours a rogue state, the other Elector Counts have joined together to make war upon you!

The expedition has increased its level of Acclaim, making great strides towards fulfilling the Emperor’s Mandate. You will now receive better-quality Imperial Supplies.\\n\\nContinue garnering Acclaim to advance the expedition’s progress and further the Imperial cause.

The Emperor’s Mandate has been successfully fulfilled. Despite there being much fanfare of your achievements up to now back home, the Huntsmarshal’s job is not over – the remaining enemies of the Empire must be vanquished!
You have weathered the storm of enemy aggression – hostility against the expedition has now returned to normal levels. Imperial Supplies will now be dispatched at regular frequency.
Your military activity has heightened the enemy’s aggression towards the expedition, increasing the hostility level. Imperial Supplies will now be dispatched more often.

The expedition’s relentless aggressions have caused hostility to rise to deadly levels – the enemy are now concentrating their military resources against you! Emergency Imperial Supplies have already been dispatched.
Your lack of military activity has caused enemy animosity to drop, reducing the hostility level. Imperial Supplies will now be dispatched less frequently.
You have weathered the storm of enemy aggression – hostility against the expedition has now returned to normal levels. Imperial Supplies will now be dispatched at normal frequency.

Following your recent military aggression, your desperate enemies have started to gather in numbers and are priming their forces for a counter-offensive. An attack is imminent…\\n\\n[[col:red]]An enemy force has appeared![[/col]]

Slander at court is not unheard of, but speaking outright untruths for political ends can be a risky business. By using the more backhanded approach of exaggerating half-truths and emphasising certain facts over others, you have successfully soured relations between the Electors of {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetFactionName}}  and {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:SecondTargetFactionName}}.

The Elector Counts exist inside a political crucible in which friendships between Electors and their states can be subtly forged or sundered through clandestine political manoeuvring. By engaging in a spot of amicable arbitration, you have improved relations between {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetFactionName}}  and {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:SecondTargetFactionName}}.
Due to concessions back home, you have received an extra shipment of reinforcements for your Imperial Supplies.
Due to concessions back home, you have received an extra shipment of reinforcements for your Imperial Supplies.
Due to concessions back home, you have received an extra shipment of reinforcements for your Imperial Supplies.

While following a trail through the dense jungle canopy you stumbled upon a clearing strewn with dead bodies. They looked like seafarers, senior admiralty of some sort perhaps, but stranger still was the fact that each had a stake through the chest and was decapitated. On closer inspection you realised they were already dead before they met this gruesome fate – in fact, not dead, but Undead. Vampires...\\n\\nA few nights later, a mysterious man emerged from the jungle, introducing himself as Hertwig van Hal. His garb indicated he was a Witch Hunter of the Empire, but he revealed himself to be the healer you have been seeking. Explaining your cause to him, you asked him to join the expedition. He accepted, but on one condition – that you help him with his own mission in Lustria in return.

Hertwig returns to you in good spirits and renewed focus, explaining that he now has a solid lead in his search. The Vampire he seeks is one of the infamous Pirate King’s closest henchmen, who actively haunts the waters of the Vampire Coast to raise more potential recruits into his master's zombie crews. To find him, some raiding may be necessary...

You helped van Hal by plundering several of the Vampire Coast’s smuggling encampments and moored galleons along the coast, so the expedition quickly gained the attentions of the Pirate King’s senior henchmen. Alistair the Red still did not reveal himself, however. After interrogating, staking, and decapitating several of the Vampire Admirals sent against the expedition, Hertwig finally obtained the location of his target’s hiding place – The Awakening, an old coastal settlement of the dead rumoured to be home to the Pirate King himself.

Following the slaying of Alistair the Red, van Hal successfully moved on from his past and has become of invaluable aid to the expedition.\\n\\nAs a token of your gratitude, you managed to pull a few strings with a specialist firearms workshop in Nuln to have a custom-crafted pistol sent over – a weapon truly befitting a Witch Hunter of the van Hal bloodline.

Following the slaying of Alistair the Red, Herr Doctor successfully moved on from his past and has become of invaluable aid to the expedition.\\n\\nAs a token of your gratitude, you managed to get in touch with a friend in Altdorf’s Cult of Shallya chapter to obtain a very special enchanted amulet, deserving of Herr Doctor’s outstanding abilities as a physician.

Finally, contact was made with the Spine of Sotek Dwarfs. They are a strange lot, and it took quite some time for you to convince them your intentions were not belligerent. Once you described who you were seeking, the throng's leaders told you it sounded very much like the Master Engineer Jorek Grimm, a secretive Dwarf who has spent long periods of time outside their Hold. It was unclear to his kin what Jorek was doing on his forays, nor did they bother to ask.\\n\\nAfter being introduced to Jorek, he agreed to join your cause, but something tells you this eccentric Dwarf's services may cost you a little more than a mercenary’s reckoning.

To Jorek’s delight, you managed to fill a large crate with the materials he suggested, dropping it before him. He scurried away, dragging the crate behind him while rambling about the brilliance of his plans and how much he will accomplish. A few days later he emerges from his makeshift workshop, sweaty and beaming, proudly holding his latest invention.

The Master Engineer Jorek Grimm is a prolific inventor indeed! The materials you gathered will enable him to continue supplying you with custom-built equipment, which will go a long way to helping the expedition, especially in between the infrequent reinforcements you receive from home.

After you secured the area containing the obsinite, Jorek immediately got to work. Within a short time of arriving he had already gathered all he needed, set up his makeshift workshop and completed the assembly of the new Gyrocopter. The flying machine is just as Jorek described and truly a masterpiece of engineering. The brilliant Master Engineer has delivered once again, proving his value.

Your activities in Lustria gained more than just the attention of angry locals. One day, as the expedition marched through the jungle following another successful offensive, you were suddenly threatened by a hooded figure standing in the trees above the jungle trail. After you introduced yourself as the Huntsmarshal – the Emperor’s Chief Scout – she descended and revealed herself to be a former Waystalker of Athel Loren, a Wood Elf huntress named Kalara. Around her neck hung a Bastiladon tooth, and it was clear from her appearance that she was a weathered warrior of the jungle.\\n\\nKalara asked you if you might help her track one particular beast she had been pursuing in Lustria. Not being one to turn down a hunt, you agreed – but only in return for lending her skills to your expedition.

Kalara has finally managed to pick up a trail. There have been a rash of slaughters that have seen entire regiments of men massacred deep in the jungle of late and she is convinced her target is responsible.\\n\\nKalara is eager for the expedition to investigate. Having fought alongside the expedition for an extended duration, she has also primed her skills for war and fashioned a new weapon for herself for use in the coming hunt.

The evidence you observed yourself at the ruins does make it seem plausible that the men were slaughtered by some sort of beast. Still, the use of weapons of war could also not be conclusively ruled out. Kalara’s resolve is strong, however, and you feel compelled to believe her. After all, the hunting senses of a Waystalker are not to be underestimated.

The beast was not found, but Kalara still refused to give up. By now you will have ascertained that there are several beasts in the jungles of these lands that appear cognisant when they shouldn’t, or larger than their normal counterparts. Privately, you know this is the reason that Kalara has been here for so long – there are just so many candidates that could feasibly contain the soul of her lover - it could be literally any of them.\\n\\nThough Kalara’s passion to slay an enormous beast has not wavered since you met her, you do not think you can continue without the truth laid clearly upon the table…

Once the area surrounding the Emerald Pools was secured, you helped Kalara construct her shrine to Isha right upon the banks of its glowing viridian waters. She then spent several days praying at the newly-built sanctum, beseeching the goddess to fulfil her promise to free Atherin’s soul from its eternal reincarnation.\\n\\nWhen Kalara finally emerged, it was clear that her prayers had been answered. Her usual sorrowful demeanour had vanished, for Isha had granted the lovers forgiveness and arranged for Atherin's soul to progress into the afterlife, thus freeing Kalara from her eternal hunt.\\n\\nKalara thanked you profoundly for your help and promised that as long as she was needed, she would continue fighting alongside the expedition.
An Elector Count has contacted you anonymously to lend his support to the expedition. He has made arrangements for you to receive additional aid from home, funded by his state.

Once you'd brought your forces to mists surrounding the temple-city of Xlanhuapec it did not take long for the Bretonnian swordsman to arrive at your camp. He revealed himself as being no mere soldier, but in fact a noble by the name of Rodrik L’Anguille who'd seen his entire retinue slaughtered whilst on an expedition into Lustria. With the massacre of his men, Rodrik was now without an army or indeed a purpose. With a vengeful tone in his voice, he told you he was willing to offer his knowledge of Xlanhuapec’s defences to enable a successful siege by your force, which of course you accepted.

Rodrik had already spent several moons with the expedition before coming to you with some dire news. His friends back home had managed to send word that those with grudges against him had become aware he was still alive in Lustria. One known as Lord Tudual not only wished for Rodrik not to return, but also that he be put to death. A small force has been sent to assassinate Rodrik!\\n\\nHowever, Rodrik has been tipped off about the location of where Lord Tudual’s force will be landing – Pox Marsh. He has beseeched you to move the expedition to intercept them immediately, to which you naturally agreed.

Much time has passed since you helped Prince Rodrik vanquish his assassins at Pox Marsh, and there has been no sign since that Duke Tudual intends to send more forces to kill him. You have assumed the duke has given up – after all, Lustria is such a large and untamed land that it can easily drain the resources of any force sent against a single man, especially one who knows the land like Rodrik now does. It is safe to say that the prince’s troubles with his father are now over.

Failure to prepare is preparing to fail! The Chevaliers’ armies take on water supplies every time they enter a settlement. Garrison your forces to grant them immunity from desert attrition for 5 turns.

The dead have long laboured under the misapprehension that they are entitled to power and property. As if mouldering abominations who stand against all that is holy should enjoy the same rights as true-hearted men! That is why Bretonnia risked good men's lives to capture one of their snickering 'kings', and took the bone-fiend's head as its Unliving followers looked on. These ungodly horrors surely now understand that they are not entitled to continued existence, let alone lands of their own.

No matter how many cellar doors were bolted, tunnels demolished or sewer pipes blocked, the pestilent ratmen always, always found a way to steal into Bretonnian lands. Countless food stolen, gold looted – and innocent lives lost.  And so came the purge. Every underground cranny was scoured for verminous heresy, every corner scrubbed of Skaven filth. Truly, it was no task for noble souls, but there was no other way.

Every morning brought more disappearances. The Vampires' stolen victims would never be found, their drained bodies lost in a heartbeat to the pitiless winds and scouring sands of the endless desert. No more. No more! In the name of the Lady, in the name of truth and purity, Bretonnia's Knights have tracked the vile blood-drinkers to their nest, thus rendering her people safe from Undying evil... for now.

Once again it is time for the Dark Elves to venture out to distant shores to plunder, pillage and most importantly, gather slaves to fuel their war machine. The mines of Naggaroth always need new flesh!

To the light-clawed agents of Clan Eshin, who delight in all forms of sneakiness, even items and followers can be pilfered and added to their personal collection – call it a perk of the job, if you will.

You have been issued a contract by the mighty Warlord Gnawdwell of Clan Mors. In a swarm of his disposable Clanrats, many of whom had died making the long journey from Skavenblight, the missive was delivered.\\n\\nEshin’s involvement in clan feuds will surely be sensed; there will be both rewards and consequences for doing a Lord of Decay’s dirty work.

You have been issued a contract by the Packlord Verminkin of Clan Moulder. The nightmarishly mutated Throtling he’d sent from Skavenblight with missive in claw-tongue was hard to look at, but it promptly died in a puddle of gory ooze once it had served its purpose.\\n\\nEshin’s involvement in clan feuds will surely be sensed; there will be both rewards and consequences for doing a Lord of Decay’s dirty work.

You have been issued a contract by the Arch-Plaguelord Nurglitch of Clan Pestilens. Everyone was rather keen to keep their distance from his repugnant messenger, a bubo-covered wretch shockingly unafflicted by his numerous weeping sores, as he delivered the missive.\\n\\nEshin’s involvement in clan feuds will surely be sensed; there will be both rewards and consequences for doing a Lord of Decay’s dirty work.

You have been issued a contract by the Emperor of Warlocks, Lord Morskittar of Clan Skryre. His Doomwheel-riding emissary arrived precariously in a cloud of toxic-smelling green smoke and was speeding back to Skavenblight just as soon as the missive was delivered.\\n\\nEshin’s involvement in clan feuds will surely be sensed; there will be both rewards and consequences for doing a Lord of Decay’s dirty work.

The Goblin King has an endless appetite, not to mention the ladz are a bunch of greedy gits. Only the final few morsels remain in Grom’s Cauldron. The Cauldron’s benefits are still active but they will dissipate unless another recipe is prepared – don’t let the boss go hungry!

The Hag merchant has etched new mysterious carvings into Grom’s Cauldron. They may appear to be just another bunch of incomprehensible scribblings to Grom and his minions, but are actually powerful incantations that allow the cauldron to extract benefits from more ingredients at a time.

The meal has been prepared and the feast has begun! Grom and his horde can now digest the powers of the chosen recipe. The ladz clamour over each other to get their share, but of course all move aside when the Goblin King eats – which is very frequently.

Grom's Cauldron is now completely empty! All special benefits being received from it have now been lost.\\n\\nHaving been spoilt by the gastronomic delights the cauldron had previously provided them, the lads are now resorting to eating Snotlings, since normal horde rations just don’t cut it anymore. We'd better get a new recipe on the go soon!
Grom is a great culinary connoisseur of a Goblin, always adding to his repertoire of meals to keep himself and the lads fed. His infamy, power and size have increased as a result!
You have discovered a new ingredient! Using it in recipes prepared in Grom’s Cauldron will grant new benefits to Grom and the ladz.

Drawn close by the scent of Grom’s constant binge-banqueting, a merchant Troll Hag has been sighted nearby. Such a dangerous creature should be approached with caution, but the Hag’s bag of dead-things will likely contain something delectable to toss into Grom’s Cauldron. Or you could just rob her..!
A new recipe has been discovered! If used, the benefits of this new culinary delight will add to Grom’s strength.
Eltharion is reinforced Yvresse's defense. Grom will not be able to take yvresse at the moment. Endless reinforcement will come from athel tarmaha, making an occupation impossible to achieve.
The Warden is defeated in the final confrontation. The revenge is now taken and Grom, is, inevitable!
The Black Dragon answered your challenge and was humbled by its defeat. The mighty Drake honours its deal with you.
The Forest Dragon answered your challenge and was humbled by its defeat. The mighty Drake honours its deal with you.
The Moon Dragon answered your challenge and was humbled by its defeat. The mighty Drake honours its deal with you.

This character was successfully captured in the previous battle! They are now being held prisoner in Athel Tamarha.
You have one less enemy in the world – this prisoner has been executed on your orders!

After capturing this enemy in battle it quickly became clear that they were too insignificant to be kept alive. After stripping them of their gold and supplies you ordered for their immediate execution.
This prisoner has been successfully indoctrinated and released back to their faction, their loyalties weakened in your favour.

Ghoritch, commander of the standing army of Clan Moulder at the Hell Pit, now stands ready to join Throt in the field. Out here then, Throt can contain his creation's meteoric successes under his own command, and Ghoritch gets to sate his berserker lust for blood once more!
Our destruction of Ariel’s Waystone has not gone unnoticed. Take heed, the Wood Elves are sending a retaliation force from the Witchwood!
Your recent efforts in healing the Glades of the world have roused Ariel from the Oak of Ages. She has emerged to lend her strength to your great cause!

A messenger from Avelorn, court of the Everqueen Alarielle, has arrived with dire news. A mighty host of Chaos has invaded their kingdom and seeks to burn it to the ground. The Daemon-worshippers’ masters thirst for Asur souls, but more than that they seek to annihilate the heirs of Aenarion and destroy the Vortex that prevents their return. Alarielle has hastily opened up the Worldroots pathway to Avelorn and beseeches you for aid.

Responding to the monstrous war cries of a bloodthirsty Beastlord, a braying horde of Beastmen has been spotted slowly amassing at the edge of the forest. There may be no rhyme or reason for them to congregate in such a manner, but their intentions are predictably destructive. It would be wise to bring them to battle before they reach full strength and start attacking the Glades.

The eyes and ears of the forest whisper rumours of looming shadows lumbering through the woodland depths. The creatures that cast them are unseen as if invisible, but the evidence of their passage is clear for all to see with pathways of downtrodden trees and flattened undergrowth mysteriously appearing without explanation. It appears that whatever the creatures are, they never stop in one place for too long. We must be wary…

Driven by all the vengeful rage of the forest, the soldiers of the wargrove march forth as the woodlands’ fiercest sentinels. Your mission is unending, for there will always be those whose folly causes harm to the wilderness, whether inadvertently or otherwise. At times, the struggle can be all-consuming, and even one with your depthless thirst for retribution can suffer from weariness and fatigue. It is in those times, however, that Coeddil projects his consciousness to commune with you, his conviction spurring you forth to continue your ceaseless task.

A strange, monstrous creature was encountered in the forest! The Dryads of the wargrove barely managed to defeat it, and those that managed to survive the encounter said it was definitely a minion of the Beastmen. Worse still, it bore the unmistakable taint of Cyanathair the Corruptor, also known as Morghur. Upon its death, the creature left behind a foul, black ichor that is corrupting the ground upon which it fell. This creature could not be Morghur himself, for the Dryads are familiar with his appearance, but the taint left behind indicates it was likely one of his offspring.

Your eyes and ears at the edge of the forest have alerted you to the presence of militiamen who are mustering in a nearby camp. You have dealt with the men of the Old World before; given your previous blood-soaked forays into their lands, they are right to fear your kind. It would be wise to attack first before they reach full strength – show them once again that the spirits of the forest are not to be trifled with!

From the cracked font of Parravon's cathedral, a great prize trickles – water blessed by the so-called Lady of the Lake. Drycha, whose memory extends to a time long before Bretonnians walked these lands, knows of the Lady's power and her connection to Athel Loren – with these waters, she can imbue her creaking, hateful host with such puissant magical protection that even the ancient wards of the Wildwood will be unable to hold them back.

We have encountered a group of men of the cold north. Though we would usually be hostile to these lesser beings, we observed them exhibiting virtues that are to be respected. They have an unusual relationship with certain creatures of the wild, riding into war upon great bears that we would usually expect to see tearing them to pieces rather than behaving as their allies. There is certainly more to these men than meets the eye…

The wretched Vampires of the Old World perpetually corrupt the lands and soil around their settlements with their Undead taint. You would usually care little for such things, yet their Necromantic magic sucks the very life out of the trees themselves while barely keeping them alive. Such a torturous existence at the hands of these vampiric parasites is no existence at all for the trees. We must counter this defilement with the magic of the forest.

As you journey across the deep forest you happen across an ancient grove of rare ash trees. Woeful whispers fill the air between the canopies, whispers of past atrocities committed against the grove throughout its unimaginably long existence. The magic is strong here, too. This is most fortuitous – the ash trees’ enchanted wood can be used to produce magically lethal arrows, sturdy and superbly weighted to travel great distances and pierce the hearts of your foes!

A Dwarf throng has been spotted at the edge of the forest seemingly readying themselves for battle. It appears their age-old grudges against the fey shall never be abated, as they are likely seeking revenge for some ancient grievance you’ve long forgotten, such is the folly of the lesser races. Even now, more battalions march to join them – it would be prudent to confront these Dwarfs before they reach full strength and threaten the Glades.
Though the battle was lost, your swift actions have forced your foes to play their hand earlier than anticipated.
Your swift action has eliminated this threat before it could fully gather.
Some of the Asrai have wandered far from Athel Loren. An opportunity has arisen that might bring them back into the fold – go to this location to find out more.

Rumours of a possible threat to the Worldroots have emerged in this region. There appears to be no immediate danger, but should you have any forces nearby it would be wise to send them to investigate further.

Your confrontation against the Druchii gave the Greenskin escapees the space they needed. You watch from a distance as their bedraggled column marches off into the mountains. Their Warboss spots you at a distance and, to your surprise, raises his fist in salute. Perhaps you have found an unlikely ally?
Word reaches you of a Greenskin raid resulting in the freeing of hundreds of captives from the Druchii slave-pens. Descriptions of the raid's leader sound oddly familiar...

Another Wood Elf faction has begun the Ritual of Rebirth in this forest. All Wood Elves will benefit from the completion of this ritual – you can choose to aid them in defending the forest while the ritual completes, or focus your attentions elsewhere.

The Ritual of Rebirth has been successfully initiated in Athel Loren. Once completed, the great forest shall be brought back to its legendary splendour and will revitalise the Worldroots beneath, but take heed – the use of ritual magic in the area has attracted the attention of Beastmen, who gather nearby to mobilise against the Great Oak. Defend it at all costs and ensure the ritual is completed!

The Ritual of Rebirth has been successfully initiated in this region. Once the forest of Sacred Pools is fully healed by the ritual it will revitalise the Worldroots beneath, but take heed – the colonists of the Empire have long planned to annex these bountiful lands, and are now moving troops into the area in preparation to march upon your position. Defend the Glade at all costs and ensure the ritual is completed!

The Ritual of Rebirth has been successfully initiated in this region. Once the Forest of Gloom is fully healed by the ritual it will revitalise the Worldroots beneath, but take heed – nearby mobs of opportunistic Forest Goblins have sensed the ritual magic emanating from the area and are amassing nearby to take this forest as their own. Defend it at all costs and ensure the ritual is completed!

The Ritual of Rebirth has been successfully initiated in this region. Once Gaean Vale is fully healed by the ritual it will revitalise the Worldroots beneath, but take heed – the ritual magic has attracted the attention of the forces of Chaos who gather nearby, ready to take advantage of any disruption to the nearby Vortex. Gaean Vale has suffered their invasions in the past, but strengthening the Worldroots here will at least help to stifle any future attempts. Defend the Glade at all costs and ensure the ritual is completed!

The Ritual of Rebirth has been successfully initiated in this region. Once Gryphon Wood is fully healed by the ritual it will revitalise the Worldroots beneath, but take heed – the malevolent and misguided Tree Spirits which reside here are ignorant to your greater purpose and blinded by their anger at your presence. They gather their forces nearby in preparation for an attack. Defend the Glade from them at all costs and ensure the ritual is completed!

The Ritual of Rebirth has been successfully initiated in this region. Once Gryphon Wood is fully healed by the ritual it will revitalise the Worldroots beneath, but take heed – the fearful men of the Empire have noticed your activities in the wood and gather nearby, intent on purging the forest of your perceived evil. Spill their blood if you must, ensure the ritual is completed!

The Ritual of Rebirth has been successfully initiated in this region. Once the Heart of the Jungle is fully healed by the ritual it will revitalise the Worldroots beneath, but take heed – nearby mobs of Savage Orcs have noticed your activities and gather nearby, their opportunistic Shamans sensing your ritual magic as an impetus to take this forest as their own. Defend it at all costs and ensure the ritual is completed!

The Ritual of Rebirth has been successfully initiated in this region. Once the Jungles of Chi’an are fully healed by the ritual it will revitalise the Worldroots beneath, but take heed – these primeval woodlands are frequented by cabals of Tzeentchian cults, one of whom has summoned forth a hideous Daemonic army that rampages towards your position. Defend the jungle to ensure the ritual is completed!

The Ritual of Rebirth has been successfully initiated in this region. Once Laurelorn Forest is fully healed by the ritual it will revitalise the Worldroots beneath, but take heed – Norscan warbands who routinely raid the ports to the north have turned their attentions unto the forest and gather nearby, compelled by their Dark Gods attracted to the ritual magic. Defend the Glade from them at all costs and ensure the ritual is completed!

The Ritual of Rebirth has been successfully initiated in this region. Once the Haunted Forest is fully healed by the ritual it will revitalise the Worldroots beneath, but take heed – a tribe of wandering Ogres wielding grossly oversized clubs have lumbered into the forest on the mindless assumption that it might be a source of exotic things to devour. Defend the forest to ensure the ritual is completed!

The Ritual of Rebirth has been successfully initiated in this region. Once the Witchwood is fully healed by the ritual it will revitalise the Worldroots beneath, but take heed – for some unseen purpose the scheming Skaven have emerged from their underground warrens at the forest’s edge, seemingly gathering strength for an attack. Defend the Glade from them at all costs and ensure the ritual is completed!

The forest you were healing was invaded and occupied while the Ritual was completed! The enemy have been unable to prevent what you started – this forest is now firmly and irrevocably connected to the Worldroots. The Forest Spirits begrudgingly grant you a piece of crystallized Amber as a reward – but they do not hide their displeasure.

A forest that was being healed was invaded and occupied while the Ritual was completed! The enemy have been unable to prevent what was started – this forest is now firmly and irrevocably connected to the Worldroots. The Forest Spirits begrudgingly grant you a piece of crystallized Amber as a reward – but they do not hide their displeasure.

You have managed to seize a glade controlled by a rival Wood Elf faction that was performing a Ritual of Rebirth! Though such healing benefits all the Wood Elves, the Forest Spirits of your faction cackle with pleasure at seeing their rivals humbled.
This forest’s health has been sufficiently buttressed – the Ritual of Rebirth is ready to be cast!
This forest’s health has been sufficiently buttressed – the Ritual of Rebirth is ready to be cast in Athel Loren!
This forest’s health has been sufficiently buttressed – the Ritual of Rebirth is ready to be cast in the Sacred Pools!
This forest’s health has been sufficiently buttressed – the Ritual of Rebirth is ready to be cast in the Forest of Gloom!
This forest’s health has been sufficiently buttressed – the Ritual of Rebirth is ready to be cast in Gaean Vale!
This forest’s health has been sufficiently buttressed – the Ritual of Rebirth is ready to be cast in Gryphon Wood!
This forest’s health has been sufficiently buttressed – the Ritual of Rebirth is ready to be cast in Gryphon Wood!
This forest’s health has been sufficiently buttressed – the Ritual of Rebirth is ready to be cast in Oreon's Camp!
This forest’s health has been sufficiently buttressed – the Ritual of Rebirth is ready to be cast in the Jungles of Chi'an!
This forest’s health has been sufficiently buttressed – the Ritual of Rebirth is ready to be cast in Laurelorn!
This forest’s health has been sufficiently buttressed – the Ritual of Rebirth is ready to be cast in The Haunted Forest!
This forest’s health has been sufficiently buttressed – the Ritual of Rebirth is ready to be cast in the Witchwood!

Another Wood Elf faction has successfully completed the Ritual of Rebirth in this forest! It is now fully healed, strengthening the Worldroots in this region and thus maintaining the balance of the Weave.

You have successfully completed the Ritual of Rebirth in Athel Loren, returning the great forest to its full glory! The Beastmen remain one of the many ever-present threats to the world’s forests, but the bolstering of the Worldroots in this region means that any further malicious intent can no longer bring significant imbalance to the Weave again.

You have successfully completed the Ritual of Rebirth, healing the Worldroots beneath the Sacred Pools and granting the forest its glory and sentience once more! Should the colonists of the Empire or any other enemies of Lustria’s forests enter here, they shall risk the wrath of the Asrai and the powerful spirits now returned to dwell amongst the Glade's boughs and branches.

You have successfully completed the Ritual of Rebirth, healing the Worldroots beneath the Forest of Gloom and granting it glory and sentience once more! You have already shown the Forest Goblins the consequences of trespassing – should they or any other interlopers enter here again they shall risk the wrath of the Asrai and the powerful spirits now returned to dwell amongst the Glade’s boughs and branches.

You have successfully completed the Ritual of Rebirth, healing the Worldroots beneath Gaean Vale and granting the forest its glory and sentience once more! The forces of Chaos shall never cease to be a grave threat to the world, but bolstering the Worldroots in this region has brought greater balance to the Weave, stifling their efforts to weaken the Vortex and allow Daemonkind into the world once again.

You have successfully completed the Ritual of Rebirth, healing the Worldroots beneath Gryphon Wood and granting the forest its glory and sentience once more! The relationship between the Asrai and the temperamental Tree Spirits of the world will always be an uneasy one, but by healing the Worldroots in this region you have brought greater balance to the Weave and shown them your actions are always for the good of the forest.

You have successfully completed the Ritual of Rebirth, healing the Worldroots beneath Gryphon Wood and granting the forest its glory and sentience once more! There will always be men driven by misguided bravery or foolishness who will try to claim the world’s forests as their own, but the revitalisation of the Worldroots in this region now means that to do so here is to risk the wrath of the powerful spirits now returned to dwell amongst the Glade's boughs and branches.

You have successfully completed the Ritual of Rebirth, healing the Worldroots beneath the Heart of the Jungle and granting it its glory and sentience once more! You have shown the Savage Orcs that the forests are not their domain and the magic of the revivified Worldroots in this region is nothing their Shamans can ever hope to understand or overcome – should they or any other interlopers enter here again they shall risk the wrath of the Asrai and the powerful spirits now returned to dwell beneath the Glade’s boughs and branches.

You have successfully completed the Ritual of Rebirth, healing the Worldroots beneath the Jungles of Chi'an and granting the forest its glory and sentience once more! The relationship between the Asrai and the temperamental Tree Spirits of the world will always be an uneasy one, but by healing the Worldroots in this region you have brought greater balance to the Weave and shown them your actions are always for the good of the forest.

You have successfully completed the Ritual of Rebirth, healing the Worldroots beneath Laurelorn Forest and granting it glory and sentience once more! The Norscan raiders will always be compelled by their Dark Gods to raid and pillage these northern lands, but with the strengthening of the Worldroots in this region they now risk the wrath of the Asrai and the powerful spirits now returned to dwell amongst the Glade's boughs and branches.

You have successfully completed the Ritual of Rebirth, healing the Worldroots beneath the Haunted Forest and granting it glory and sentience once more! The Undead travel far and wide, but you have been purged them from the woods, bringing greater balance to the Weave.

You have successfully completed the Ritual of Rebirth, healing the Worldroots beneath the Witchwood and granting the forest its glory and sentience once more! The reinvigoration of the Worldroots in this region means that should the unpredictable Skaven emerge from their underground lairs here again, they shall risk the wrath of the Asrai and the powerful spirits now returned to dwell amongst the Glade’s boughs and branches.

A verminous horde of Skaven has started emerging from the ground at the edge of the forest. Their specific purpose is unclear, but their squalid, parasitic ways are more than just an affront to the Weave. The skittering ratmen and the twisted creatures of their foul ranks are abominations of nature and represent everything you stand against. More of them are still emerging, but by pre-emptively attacking you can prevent them from reaching full strength.

Orion, King in the Woods and Master of the Wild Hunt, is reborn anew. On the eve of the vernal equinox, the elite Wild Riders select a candidate to bear the mantle of the immortal Elven King for the year ahead.\\n\\nNow that Queen Ariel has done her secret work, Orion storms back into the world once more. As ever, he immediately calls a Wild Hunt to clear the forest of undesirable outsiders. The Herald of the Hunt sounds the Horn, signalling the Elves and forest spirits to fight in Athel Loren's defence – a primal urge to expel the forest's enemies that none can ignore.\\n\\n[[img:bullet_wef_units]][[/img]][[col:green]] All office holders are now receiving additional effects from the Wild Hunt![[/col]]

Now, at last, the Wild Hunt is over and Athel Loren rests once again.\\n\\nThe power of Kurnous flowed through the Wild Riders and all who joined the Hunt in the forest's name. The pace was furious; the Hunt charging along hidden paths and through the usually-gentle glades. Any creatures unlucky enough to be caught were shown no mercy, their deaths serving as a noble sacrifice to Orion's ageless grandeur.

Fully grown monster specimens have formed within the Growth Vat and are ready to be released, should you wish. The longer a batch is left to grow, however, the better the quality of the units grown. More advanced batches will only result in negligible increases of Mutagen by-product.

Some of your excess Mutagen which could not be properly stored has decayed into uselessness! Mutagen is an unstable substance that must be kept under careful conditions and the Flesh Laboratory has limited storage space. Your standard capacity is [[img:icon_mutagen]][[/img]]100, but can be expanded to [[img:icon_mutagen]][[/img]]200 once the Flesh Laboratory has been upgraded.

You have emptied the Growth Vat and your specimens are ready for immediate recruitment from the Growth Vat recruitment panel. The batch also includes some surviving Skavenslaves that had been thrown in as feed.

You have emptied the Growth Vat to reveal a superior batch of monstrous specimens! Your freshly grown units are now ready for immediate recruitment from the Growth Vat recruitment panel along with some surviving Skavenslaves that had been thrown in as feed.
You have emptied the Growth Vat to reveal an optimum batch of monstrous specimens! Your freshly grown units are now ready for immediate recruitment from the Growth Vat recruitment panel.

You have emptied the Growth Vat and your specimens are ready for immediate recruitment from the Growth Vat recruitment panel. The batch also includes some surviving Skavenslaves that had been thrown in as feed.

You have emptied the Growth Vat to reveal a superior batch of monstrous specimens! Your freshly grown units are now ready for immediate recruitment from the Growth Vat recruitment panel along with some surviving Skavenslaves that had been thrown in as feed.

You have emptied the Growth Vat to reveal a superior batch of monstrous specimens! Your freshly grown units are now ready for immediate recruitment from the Growth Vat recruitment panel along with some surviving Skavenslaves that had been thrown in as feed.

You have emptied the Growth Vat to reveal an optimum batch of monstrous specimens! Your freshly grown units are now ready for immediate recruitment from the Growth Vat recruitment panel along with some surviving Skavenslaves that had been thrown in as feed.

You have emptied the Growth Vat and your specimens are ready for immediate recruitment from the Growth Vat recruitment panel. The batch also includes some surviving Skavenslaves that had been thrown in as feed.

You have emptied the Growth Vat to reveal a superior batch of monstrous specimens! Your freshly grown units are now ready for immediate recruitment from the Growth Vat recruitment panel along with some surviving Skavenslaves that had been thrown in as feed.

You have emptied the Growth Vat to reveal an optimum batch of monstrous specimens! Your freshly grown units are now ready for immediate recruitment from the Growth Vat recruitment panel along with some surviving Skavenslaves that had been thrown in as feed.

You have emptied the Growth Vat and your specimens are ready for immediate recruitment from the Growth Vat recruitment panel. The batch also includes some surviving Skavenslaves that had been thrown in as feed.

You have emptied the Growth Vat to reveal a superior batch of monstrous specimens! Your freshly grown units are now ready for immediate recruitment from the Growth Vat recruitment panel along with some surviving Skavenslaves that had been thrown in as feed.

You have emptied the Growth Vat to reveal an optimum batch of monstrous specimens! Your freshly grown units are now ready for immediate recruitment from the Growth Vat recruitment panel along with some surviving Skavenslaves that had been thrown in as feed.

Following your previous foray into battle, you have received word from Lord Daith that the forge fires are now lit and ready. The old master is now ready to lend his unrivalled smithing skills to your great cause.

Lord Daith, the legendary Elven smith of Athel Loren and your ‘surrogate uncle’, has sent word that he has been busy at work within Vaul’s Anvil. Amongst the searing heat of the temple’s enchanted fires, the blind craftsman forged four pieces of magical equipment. He has delivered these gifts via his emissaries to aid you with your grave task.

Your current rampage has ended! You did not win successive battles quickly enough, resulting in a loss of too much Momentum. Win your next battle to start a new rampage and work towards receiving the Dark Gods’ rewards.

The Dark Gods are impressed by your recent battle streak! You may now invoke them to empower the warherd with even greater prowess on the battlefield. Maintain your current momentum by continually winning battles to increase your current Savage Rampage streak.\\n\\n[[col:green]]Access the Rampage panel to choose your reward.[[/col]]

The Dark Gods are impressed by your recent battle streak! You may now invoke them to empower the warherd with greater campaign capabilities. Maintain your current momentum by continually winning battles to increase your current Cataclysmic Rampage streak.\\n\\n[[col:green]]Access the Rampage panel to choose your reward.[[/col]]

The Dark Gods are impressed by your recent battle streak! You may now invoke them to call upon powerful Beastmen or monsters to join your warherd.\\n\\n[[col:green]]Access the Rampage panel to choose your reward.[[/col]]

The Ritual of Ruin is complete! In return for the devastation caused across your Blood-grounds you have received Marks of Ruination, thus elevating the herd to a higher status in the eyes of the Dark Gods.

The Ritual of Ruin is complete! In return for the devastation caused across your Blood-grounds you have received Marks of Ruination, thus elevating the herd to a higher status in the eyes of the Dark Gods.\\n\\nOn this occasion you have received only a sliver of the Gods’ recognition for your ritual as the great weird moon Morrslieb hangs low and whole in the sky, its eerie incandescence a sign of their current apathy.

The Ritual of Ruin is complete! In return for the devastation caused across your Blood-grounds you have received Marks of Ruination, thus elevating the herd to a higher status in the eyes of the Dark Gods.\\n\\nThe suffusion of the moon in the dark crimson of a lunar eclipse indicates the Gods are in a vengeful mood, perhaps with their attentions diverted elsewhere. Yet the herd’s ascension is a sign they have still afforded you the acknowledgment you deserve.

The Ritual of Ruin is complete! In return for the devastation caused throughout your Blood-grounds you have received Marks of Ruination, thus elevating the herd to a higher status in the eyes of the Dark Gods.\\n\\nWith Morrslieb ascendant, usurping the sun and overshadowing the world in a sickly hue, it is clear the Ruinous Powers have given this ritual their complete attention and full recognition for your savage deeds!

When you took to the High Throne, you swore to avenge every Grudge recorded against the Dawi.\\n\\nHaving struck one such Grudge from the book, the venerable Brewing Guilds have thrown a succession of feasts in your honour.
When you took to the High Throne, you swore to avenge every grudge recorded against the Dawi.\\n\\nHaving struck one such Grudge from the book, the Smith-Clans bring your tributes of gold.

When you took to the High Throne, you swore to avenge every grudge recorded against the Dawi.\\n\\nHaving struck one such Grudge from the book, wandering Slayers have chosen to pledge themselves to you, seeing in your deeds a sure path to a glorious death.

When you took to the High Throne, you swore to avenge every grudge recorded against the Dawi.\\n\\nHaving struck one such Grudge from the book, Thanes of another Clan bring tributes of valuable Oathgold.

Falling into a momentary trance, you are tormented by several visions of Chaos' machinations around the world, in which you foresee terrible events at the hands of the Ruinous Masters’ thralls. If you are to stand a chance to thwart these threats, you must move quickly!\\n\\n[[col:green]]Access the Visions of the Old Ones panel to view and select missions to thwart Chaos activity.[[/col]]

You have collected enough Sanctum Gems to unlock a new Sanctum. Choose any visible location in the world to access powers enshrined there by the Old Ones.\\n\\n[[col:green]]Construct new Sanctums via the button at the top of the main campaign interface.[[/col]]
This is not much of a find, all in all - your troops have no need of these second-rate weapons, that may crumble when used in anger.
There's some really fine pieces here! After taking a few that take your fancy, your warriors take their pick of the remainder. Pleased, they pledge to fight with renewed fervour.
Having seen you cherry-pick the best pieces for yourself, your warriors are less than impressed with the leftovers; the brittle blades break on impact and the shields splinter when touched.
Thinking laterally, you realise that, although your own troops are well supplied, your allies who would find these weapons useful in their struggles against the foe.
Possibly, you've misjudged your allies - they scoff at the poorly made weapons and begin to question your integrity. Sometimes, a good deed is its own punishment.
Weapons? We can forge finer blades ourselves. Beyond the barracks lies an untouched temple, offerings to the gods still littered about it. This is the reason why we came here.
Weapons? We can forge finer blades ourselves. It would appear that they are the only treasure to be found here - a thorough search of the city reveals nothing of any real value.
The dead are best left that way; disturbing corpses is never a good idea. You leave the battlefield at once and pay it no more heed.
Whilst digging a grave for the bodies you find a box buried beneath the ground, inside which is the reward for your compassionate nature.
You bury the casualties of the battle in a large, shallow grave. You briefly muse on the waste that conflict causes, before dismissing such dangerous thoughts from your mind.
Most of the equipment has already been looted or destroyed by the victors. However, a corpse, half-buried in the mud, still clutches a most curious item...
Your retainers quickly establish that the corpses have already been looted - there's nothing of value to be found here.
There's a collection of what looks like Elven statues inside the warehouse. An art dealer of your acquaintance will be happy to take them off your hands for an excellent price.
There's a number of what appear to be Elven statues inside the warehouse. An art dealer of your acquaintance is quick to tell you they are little more than junk, however.
The Black Dragon could return at any moment. If it does it's reasonable to presume that you're whole party is dead. Therefore, it would be wise to not disturb the nest.
Acting quickly, your retainers are able to take the eggs from the nest and get away safely. The trade in Dragon eggs is booming; you will make an excellent profit.
Acting quickly your retainers are able to take the eggs from the nest and get away safely. However, you are unable to sell them as no one believes they are real!
Dragon eggs are hard to sell and dangerous to transport. Instead you search through the bones in the base of the nest and find something shining in the debris.
Turning from the eggs you begin your search of the nest. At that point, the Dragon returns and attacks! You manage to escape relatively unscathed, but there is a huge rend in your armour.
Leaving the nest you decide to search the surrounding area. Below the Dragon's nest lies a horde of treasure that must have fallen from above during a hasty, airborne escape!
Leaving the nest safely behind, you search the surrounding area but to no avail. It's time to give up on the day - maybe tomorrow will be more fruitful?
Dwarfholds are seldom left unguarded, so it would be unwise to try the doors. You back up slowly, in case you trigger a booby-trap left behind by a particularly sharp-witted Engineer.
It is apparent that you have stumbled upon an abandoned Dwarf brewery. Naturally, you take the Dwarfs intoxicating ale and hold a great feast to celebrate your conquests!
A rush of wind blows you backwards and there is a strange crackle in the air. You notice various runes around the room; this is a Dwarfen trap to nullify magic before it can be used against them!
Picking the second entrance, you unlock the door and peer cautiously inside. It would appear that you've hit the jackpot - a chest of Dwarfen gold left entirely unguarded!
Unfortunately, as soon as you prise the door open a powder keg explodes, throwing you backwards in the blast. Although the booby-trap failed to kill you, your wounds slow progress.
Ever cautious of Dwarfen ingenuity, you gently push the third door open. Inside, you find a store room bursting with valuable trade goods that can be sold or bartered.
Cautiously, knowing the Dwarfs capable of laying ingenious traps for the unwary trespasser, you open the third door... to find a room full of beard-grooming products! Bah!
These are Greenskins we're talking about - it could easily be a trap! It would be best if you didn't approach the campfire and considered moving on to another ruin altogether.
You help the Shaman to his feet. He chants something strange, and suddenly your hands are overflowing with gold! It's almost tempting not to kill him...
You help the Shaman to his feet. Bizarrely, instead of trying to kill you, he chants something strange instead, before capering off into the sunset!
You cautiously approach the prone Shaman and search his body. Fighting the urge to vomit, you find a few trinkets and beat a hasty retreat.
You warily approach the unconscious Shaman and search his body. The search is less than successful, and you may never feel clean again!
You tie up the Shaman and interrogate him. His babbling is incomprehensible, but he does produce a magical item from the folds of his robes.

After much incoherent gibbering, you decide to cut the Shaman loose and he capers away. That turns out to be the wrong move - you soon realise that the thieving git has picked your pockets whilst making his exit!
There is no obvious way of getting into the vault safely, let alone retrieving the armour and getting out again. Your retainers will just have to survive without it.
The armour is far too large and cumbersome to carry out of the flooded chamber without specialised equipment. However, whilst inspecting it, your men find a most interesting item.
Your men quickly discover that the armour is far too heavy to retrieve from the water. After a thorough search of the vault you leave empty-handed.
The armour is indeed the work of a master armourer, and it's surprisingly light too. Your retainers have no problems recovering it from the flooded vault.

One of your retainers assures you that he has the perfect magical item for this job. The Mage enters the vault alone and soon after there is a huge explosion, burying him and the magical item deep beneath the ground.
