Even stone may weaken and crumble with the passage of time. A building within this region has deteriorated unexpectedly and must be repaired - get to it with haste!

Fathoming the Great Plan is not the exact science it once was. In the misguided belief that their talents may be lent to astromancy, the Mage-Priests have been committing fewer Kroxigors to heavy construction duties, effectively slowing the rate of local growth.

A rich vein of uncommonly dense obsinite has been unearthed at the edges of the Copper Desert. Properly worked, it produces a razor-sharp blade with incredible handling that can turn aside lesser weapons with ease. The Skink artisans have set to work forging it into new weapons for distribution among the armed forces. As a result, melee defence capabilities have risen factionwide.

A battle-scarred Saurus Oldblood has come to your attention at the urging of the Mage-Priests. More feral than his brethren, he has a natural empathy with the great beasts of Lustria, who rally to him as one of their own. With much fasting and meditation, others are learning to commune in this fashion. As a result, recruitment costs for monstrous creatures have fallen factionwide.

It is whispered that elements of this army once visited Quetza, the defiled city, and were irrevocably changed by what they saw. Such rumours have reached fever-pitch of late and the Slann would do well to quash them! This army now suffers low leadership and increased recruitment costs.

A new fashion for inscribing the symbol of Hexoatl, the city of the sun, into armour-pieces is spreading throughout the empire. All your armies now have increased leadership when facing the forces of Chaos, Norsca, Beastmen and Vampire Counts.
Fragments of an ancient tablet have been unearthed, chronicling matters from the age of the Old Ones. This is a cause for great celebration – both leadership and control have risen here!

While honing his channelling skills, a local Mage-Priest became distracted by some deep rumination. Instead of remotely unleashing a magic missile from the nearby Skink Priest, the Winds of Magic reached critical mass within it, causing the creature's skull to loudly – and very publicly – detonate. The local inhabitants have taken this as a dire omen, and control has fallen in this province as a result!

A new decree has been passed, venerating the ever-vigilant Temple Guard. Performing displays of their peerless halberd mastery in the central plazas of the temple-cities, they swell with pride for their calling and your people are energised like never before. Temple Guard recruitment costs have fallen and control has risen factionwide as a result.

There are many veterans in your empire, employing the skills they learned through armed service in the civic sphere. Engineering, geology, cartography… these are noble and useful pursuits, but war beckons! Perhaps the time has come to re-acquaint them with their blades? Recruitment costs and starting experience have both increased factionwide as a result.

One may fear the unknown, but as the true shape of a thing is ascertained - as its strengths and weaknesses are appraised - fear gives way to an understanding of its limitations. Through a recent educational program, your troops are coming to understand their enemies better and thus fear them less. As a result, leadership when fighting Skaven and Dark Elves has now increased factionwide.

In pursuit of greater knowledge, the Skink Chiefs have been urging their artisans and engineers to meditate upon Ten-Zlati, the finder of the Lost Plaques, and to emulate his thirst for understanding. As a result, technology research rates have increased.
A skilled assassin has murdered his way up the ranks to offer loyalty to you. As a result of his sterling efforts, this Hero is now available for service.
In an effort to impress with his talents, a rising Warlock Engineer skitterleaps from an adjoining chamber directly into your presence. It works! This intrepid Hero is now available for service!

The clan's Warlock Engineers have found an ingenious use for their ailing slaves… bones are ground into a rich cement, making for an endless supply of mortar. Due to this most excellent development, building costs have decreased factionwide.

The slavemasters have been issued with a new style of lash coated with hundreds of tiny venomous barbs. Fearing its burning lacerations, the Skavenslaves are stepping up the pace. Naturally, army movement capacity has now increased factionwide.
A building's foundations have disintegrated, with whole sections collapsing on top of the hapless Skaven working below. It must be repaired before it can perform its function again.

A virulent strain of the Oozing-Eye Death has torn through the Skavenslave population in this province, devastating a vital source of food and labour. Following this disaster for productivity, growth in the this province has decreased.

An enterprising Warlock Engineer has been further befouling the already noisome military rations with tiny quantities of fine, powdered Warpstone, and its effects are already becoming apparent! The Clanrats appear more hench and jittery than usual; whiskers twitch to unfelt breezes, and ears tremble at the call of distant voices. Melee infantry factionwide now have increased melee attack and leadership as a result of his ingenious actions.

Reports are rife of Rat Ogres, Hell Pit Abominations and other monstrous units devouring the Skaven around them without warning. Is this the work of some foul saboteur from without? A rival who seeks to upset your rule perhaps? As a result of this outrage, recruitment costs for monstrous units have fallen but growth has taken a factionwide hit also.

Scurrilous rumours regarding this army's quartermasters abound. They issue the worst weapons and armour, keeping the best for themselves; they skim the rations and worse yet whisper mockeries of the Great Horned Rat! The rank-and-file are restive, and it's becoming increasingly expensive to bribe newcomers into joining - army leadership is down, and recruitment costs have risen.

Some enterprising scribe has mass-produced and issued thousands of parchment images of a blushing, beardless Dwarf in his birthday-suit! You can't turn a corner in the Undercity without seeing a pack of Clanrats punching each other and snickering uncontrollably at a poster of 'Nudey No-Beard'! Funnily enough, leadership versus Dwarfs has risen factionwide.

This province has seen record-sized litters in recent years and the population is booming. Packs of Skavenslaves and Clanrats swell and, as every young buck knows, there is strength in numbers. Both leadership and control in the province have risen as a result of this good news.

A celebrity Storm-Vermin pit-fighter has been slain... but not in the ring. The opponent he was due to face was spotted fleeing with a pack of Gutter Runners as his porcupined corpse breathed its last! While such events are commonplace in the warrens, the fans have been denied their sport and that is something that just won't stand; the province is in uproar, and control has fallen as a result!

Torture detachments have been deployed across your armed forces. While the Clanrats troops scavenge for goods and provisions, they set to work on the local inhabitants, clawing the locations of secret stashes and caches from their hapless subjects. Raiding and sacking income have both increased factionwide as a result of this excellent plan.

The green Warp-glow of Morrslieb, the evil moon, waxes sick and bright above this army. The Clanrats are invigorated by its iridescent energies, recovering from their wounds and replacing their numbers more swiftly than usual. Army replenishment rate has increased due to the great, weird moon's baleful influence.

The Council of Thirteen has decreed that the Warlock Engineers must step up their research efforts - on pain of death! A breathtakingly grisly list of execution methods has been circulated, each devised by the twelve earthbound Council-members, the thirteenth being, simply, a sacrifice to the Horned Rat. Unsurprisingly, your research rate has increased factionwide!

A new form of directed explosive have been devised specifically for weakening walls. Your sappers have been trained to burrow deep beneath the foundations before placing the bombs for best effect. Few survive the perilous process but no matter, for these new weapons are proving highly effective - factionwide enemy siege holdout time has been reduced as a result.

Burrowing and delving deep beneath the Vaults, your miner-prospectors have unearthed a vast Warpstone geode, untouched since the Great Catastrophe! This motherlode is the richest source seen in many years, and Warp-technology unit recruitment costs have fallen factionwide as a result of this enormous boon.
Following your acceptance of their offer to fight with you, Gotrek and Felix are now yours to command.

The stench of death pervades the air, rising from the bloody corpses littering the battlefield as far as the eye can see. It isn't long before the Harpies descend. On leathery wings they circle the field of battle, searching for their next meal.\\n\\nIt is all too easy for you to break their spirits, and teach them the meaning of obedience. They will make for fine additions to your menagerie of monsters.

Even the primeval horrors of the deep are no match for your iron will! Lured to the surface by the clashing of battle and churning of the waves, a brutish Kharibdyss is now bound to your control.\\n\\nHow delicious the terror of your foes will be, as they flee from the writhing mass of tentacles that seek to crush their bones and deliver them whole into the creature's gaping maw.

A slew of bodies litter the Underway, strewn at odd angles amidst a sea of blood and viscera. Every corpse exudes the rank scent of death, drawing in the creatures that call these underground tunnels home.\\n\\nGiant Spiders soon skitter into view, ready to feast in the aftermath of battle. Breaking them shall prove a simple task. Once they succumb to your control, they will have more than enough corpses to sink their fangs into.

In the looming dark of the Underway, the Squigs make their home, hopping aimlessly from meal to meal. Such simple creatures are easily broken.\\n\\nDrawn in by the sounds of battle echoing through their caves, they now make their new home among your impressive array of broken creatures. Vicious and brimming with violent hunger, these cave-dwelling monstrosities are obedient to your every word, and feast on the flesh of your enemies.

The long-absent Beastmasters stagger unannounced from your audience. Scratches and bite-marks beriddle them – a few, you're sure, are curiously absent.\\n\\nThey hail from the Mountains of Mourn, heartland of the Ogre Kingdoms. Struggling at their heels are the Ogres' native beasts – Sabretusks, snarling and disobedient, followed by a more familiar sight: a great, solemn bear.\\n\\nThough not a noteworthy haul, you may yet have room in your ranks for this fodder.

Your surprise is visible when the novice Beastmasters you'd sent to the Darklands – second-class tamers whom, you were sure, could scarcely wrangle a Squig – arrive at your capital with a Wyvern in tow.\\n\\nWith little invitation, the Beastmasters recount their story. Stopping for supplies at Pigbarter, they'd encountered a Gnoblar caravan with the Wyvern for sale – an extortionate price, you're told. It was then that one of the more unskilled Beastmasters had the bright idea to simply slaughter the caravan and take the beast.\\n\\nHardly impressive Beastmastery, but a rare find nonetheless.

Upon returning from the beast markets of Naggaroth, the Beastmaster aspirants revealed that they successfully haggled to obtain one Feral Manticore and two flocks of bloodthirsty Harpies for your Monster Pens. There may be hope for them after all!

The Beastmasters have returned from the beast markets of Naggaroth, half in number but with an extremely impressive haul – a titanic War Hydra that had devoured an unfortunate portion of the novices en route, but is now amongst the most potent weapons in your Monster Pens.\\n\\nYour Beastmasters’ heavy-handed approach with the merchants and the mention of the Beastlord’s name have also spread fear throughout the marketplaces in the Land of Chill, temporarily driving down prices – but only for you, of course.

The Beastmasters have returned from their Lustrian expedition alive with a very decent catch of Feral Cold Ones and a Feral Stegadon for the Monster Pens.\\n\\nThe aspirants have more than proven their considerable wrangling skills, for Lustrian game is notoriously hard to tame. Such skills, however, are beneath your unmatched control of these beasts through willpower alone.

The Beastmasters have proudly returned from Lustria with perhaps the greatest trophy the jungle could offer for your Monster Pens – a Carnosaur!\\n\\nThe aspirants relate to you the arduousness of the perilous hunt which required the impromptu wrangling of some wild Cold Ones to provide the necessary mobility in the harsh, unfamiliar terrain, an experience which has granted them additional knowledge of the ferocious mounts’ unpredictable ways.

The Beastmasters returned from the Old World with a haul of Exploding Squigs and Giant Spiders for the Monster Pens – a decent return, but no more than what you expected from the home of the world’s more tameable beasts.\\n\\nBy not returning empty-handed, the aspirants have at least shown basic aptitude in beast control, sparing them the disgrace of being exiled from your retinue.

Having opted to make a perilous journey deep into Norsca, the Beastmasters have returned with a bountiful haul of Ice Bears and a fully grown Feral Mammoth for the Monster Pens.\\n\\nThe expedition was also able to secure some Norscan captives who you were told put up quite the fight, being considerably stronger than the men of the south due to their proximity to the Chaos Wastes. They shall make fine slaves indeed!

The Beastmaster novices have returned from their journey to Ghrond, bringing with them a mighty Black Dragon for your Monster Pens reared by the Hag Sorceress’ very own High Beastmasters.\\n\\nThe novices also bear a gift from Morathi herself, a writ of tainted gold inscribed with a mysterious incantation of ephemeral power the likes of which you have come across before.

The Beastmaster novices have exceeded your expectations, returning from Ghrond with one of the Hag Sorceresses’ mighty Black Dragons for your Monster Pens, in addition to a shrieking Bloodwrack Medusa captured from beneath Spiteful Peaks.\\n\\nThe novices also bear a gift from Morathi herself, a writ of tainted gold inscribed with a mysterious incantation of ephemeral power, the likes of which you have come across before...

Nakai and his horde were no match for the military prowess of your beastly menagerie! The great Kroxigor failed in his attempt to free his Lustrian kin, leaving you free to bolster the Monster Pens with the Black Ark’s cargo.

A great trail of bloody hoofprints winds through the woods. You stalk it for days to secure the kill, only to find the cloven creature’s corpse already set upon by a sleuth of Bears. These hulking hunters must have brought down the colossus by themselves, through sheer might – impressive, you must admit.\\n\\nNo matter. The bears cease their gorging at the crack of your lash – they’ll soon have plenty more to eat.

Through ruthless leadership and unparalleled skill, your raid has borne the most precious fruit. A number of violent and savage Cold Ones have been captured prowling the region, ripe for the breaking. Soon they will be bent to your every whim.\\n\\nHunting in packs, these feral, reptilian predators will track down your prey, tearing them limb from bloody limb. These cold-blooded hunters make for a worthy addition to your beastly collection.

Nestled amidst treacherous mountain peaks lie the salt-stained caves of the Harpies, where an entire flock of the winged beasts have been caught and chained by your raiding party.\\n\\nTheir will is no match for that of such an illustrious Beastmaster. Under your sway, they will attack and harass your enemies, descending on them with ravenous fury. Soaring high above the battlefield, they will heed your call, and devour the enemy in a swarm of sharp teeth and vicious claws.

Your raid has uncovered a most rare and coveted prize. Lured from its bone-strewn mountain lair, a tamed Hydra makes for an awe-striking trophy of your mastery and skill.\\n\\nA gargantuan, many-headed monster, the Hydra is capable of decimating scores of enemies, its voracious appetite never sated. All will look on you with fear and reverence, for the binding of such a magnificent creature is a feat to be envied by all.

A blizzard envelops the icy wastes, putting a stop to your scavenging and forcing you to take shelter in a frozen cave. You strike a torch, only to find yourself encircled by a dozen hungry Ice Bears – their lumbering frames quickly staggering between you and the exit.\\n\\nThough the Bears emanate a chilling ferocity, you need only best the largest to earn their fear. When the winds subside, these beasts will serve you in battle.

To witness the power and ferocity of the Manticore is to witness an incarnation of Khaine himself. An instrument of carnage and murder, the Manticore your raiders have captured is a creature of Chaos and corruption, mutated into a horrifying form.\\n\\nThe hulking, leonine beast soars into battle on dark, leathery wings. A boon for any Beastmaster to have tamed, for few who come face to face with these feral creatures live to tell the tale.

Foraging for firewood among the endless crags, your forces are ambushed by Sabretusks. These vicious, feline creatures – perhaps escapees of a nearby Ogre tribe – must have stalked you for some time, given their evident voracity.\\n\\nBut the element of surprise is no match for a Beastmaster of Karond Kar. Freshly captured, this pack will serve your conquests in short order.

Far from the forest trail, you weave between towering trees, and a maze of silken strands holding the bones of those who walked this path before you. Large, black shadows creep along the edge of your vision, drawing you ever deeper into their web.\\n\\nYou soon find yourself in a Giant Spiders' lair, where countless eyes stare back at you from the darkness. They don't attack. Instead, they wait, ready to obey your first command.

Your venture through the perilous Wasteland has proven profitable indeed. Not long into your journey, your raiding party comes across a ravenous band of Exploding Squigs, as volatile as they are unintelligent.\\n\\nBinding them to your will proves no real challenge, yet their pointed teeth and gaping maws will surely be a boon in battle. With a single command, they will descend on your enemies, attacking with explosive intent.

Raiding the vast, dense jungles of Lustria proves prosperous indeed with the capture of a mighty Stegadon. Shielded by scales and spikes of bone, the great, horned beast is a nigh-on unstoppable force when charging, striking fear into the hearts of even the hardiest warrior.\\n\\nBroken and tamed, it will defend your territories aggressively, and give any attacker sufficient cause for fleeing. When called upon, the bulky frame of the Stegadon will brush aside anything in your way.

Prowling the wild forests of this region, wolf packs descend upon the unwary in search of their next meal. Thus, it was but a matter of time before your raids into their territory resulted in a confrontation. Though wild, vicious and resourceful, the whole pack is soon cornered and ensnared by your men.\\n\\nBrought before you, it seems they recognise the ice in your veins, and the cruelty of your gaze. It would seem that this pack has found a new leader.

Charred bones and scorched earth mark a trail across the desert, leading you on a hunt of the greatest peril. A Wyvern awaits you in its lair, monstrous in size, and as savage as the landscape it calls home.\\n\\nWhen the beast bears its teeth, you crack your whip in response. The battle of wills that commences feels like it lasts an age, until finally the dust settles, and the Wyvern bows its mighty head.

On leathery wings and powerful leonine legs, the Manticore prowls amidst the ruined camp. How kind of the Northmen to leave such a prize behind!\\n\\nThe creature roars with an unabated, primal fury, yet something shifts once its menacing gaze meets your own. At once there is an understanding between you, a shared kinship of cruelty and violence that quickly earns you the Manticore's undying trust.

A Dragon rears before you, spreading colossal wings that leave the whole of its pen in shadow. Your fellow Druchii have surpassed themselves in securing such a creature, and now it is yours for the taking!\\n\\nYou close the distance, letting the beast feel the steel of your glare, before pressing a single palm to the Dragon's snout. Its ferocious spirit calms at your touch, and at once you know this awe-striking beast is entirely under your sway.

Your conquest has uncovered a most promising find – a Medusae, hideous and vengeful, writhes against the chafing grip of her chains. Her face is masked, to hide her deadly gaze, for one look into her haunted eyes would send the blood spilling from your every pore.\\n\\nThese tortured creatures are no match for the Beastlord of Karond Kar, however. They will make for a fine addition to your menagerie of monsters; you need only take hold of their chains.

The battle is done, and territory is not all you claim in your victory. The ravenous Squigs that once roamed aimlessly among these filth-ridden, Greenskin hovels have been rounded up and brought before you. A fine gift!\\n\\nThough pitifully simple and unintelligent as they are, their razor-sharp teeth and ravenous hunger will make them a worthwhile addition to your monstrous collection, once broken. And breaking them will prove enjoyable indeed.

Though they were no match for your might, these pitiful Greenskin louts did at least one thing right. A majestic Wyvern roars in its pen, no doubt hatched and raised by the same unfortunate fools that lie dead at its feet.\\n\\nAs wild as the creature appears, it soon bends to your will. Such a menacing beast will serve you well, for the shadow it casts on your enemies will be terrifying indeed.

The haughty looks and condescension of the your Elf cousins count for nothing in the face of your might, and in their defeat you gain the most precious of prizes. To think, the glorious strength and power of a Dragon lies in such a comparatively small egg!\\n\\nYour men whet their lips with ambition; to consume the egg is to consume the Dragon's power. Yet your ambitions are altogether more practical. A Dragon hatchling is no small boon for a Beastmaster, after all.

The bears of Kislev are truly a sight to behold. How could you resist but to steal some for your monstrous collection? Such powerful beasts belong amidst the throngs of fearsome creatures under your thrall.\\n\\nTheir roar is truly deafening, yet they submit to the crack of your whip like any other. Kislev shall soon be a distant dream; these noble bears of war are now but beasts of Karond Kar.

A pack of ferocious Ice Bears are the spoils of your latest conquest, once owned by the human kingdom of ice and snow. To break the will of such a beast is a feat of legend among the Kislevites, but surely a small task for a Beastmaster such as yourself.\\n\\nWith gnashing teeth, the bravest of them powers towards you, before the crack of your whip sends it stumbling to a stop. Soon, each bear buckles under the weight of your compulsion; a legendary feat indeed.

The spoils of victory often come in all manner of shapes and sizes. On this day, your reward is in the capture of the titanic, bestial mount of the Lizardmen — the apex predator among the jungles of Lustria.\\n\\nThe Carnosaur fears nothing and no-one, yet even as terrifying a creature as this can be broken. With the right pressure and pain, this ferocious hunter is little more than another valuable tool in your impressive menagerie of beasts.

As the pitiful Lizardmen settlement falls under your control, so too does their prized possession. The massive, heavy frame of the Stegadon is a sight to behold; a mighty creature of immeasurable power, soon to be under your thumb.\\n\\nSet upon your foes, the mighty Stegadon will charge headlong into their ranks with bone-crushing force, and make the survivors flee in terror. The wonderous array of beasts in your pens grows all the mightier for having this monstrous creature among them.

With glorious victory comes a most rare and coveted prize! The Norscans have raised from infancy a gargantuan Mammoth, brimming with the energies and mutations of Chaos.\\n\\nA huge, hulking monstrosity of raw power and strength, the Mammoth is a rare sight but for those tamed by the Norscans. Now this beast — whose tusks are longer than most men are tall — will reside among your company of monsters, as both a powerful weapon and a testament to your glory.

The hardy Norscans fight with rage and fury, yet cannot stand against your might. Their snowy settlement falls to your forces and everything within it is now yours by right, including their ferocious canine pets.\\n\\nThese wolves are vicious, but no longer feral after being bred and tamed by the Norscans. All the easier for you to bend them to your will, and add them to the already expansive collection of beasts under your control.

The spoils of victory are eternally sweet! Penned away deep within the Ogre encampment, a pack of Sabretusks growl at your intrusion, bearing their monstrous fangs.\\n\\nTheir will is no match for your own, of course. It takes no time at all to break the beasts and bind them to your command. Their ghastly fangs shall soon be tearing into your foes, ripping them limb from bloody limb.

The forested outpost of the Wood Elves has fallen to your peerless might, yet land is not all you claim from your conquest. The beady, black eyes of numerous Giant Spiders follow you from their cages, mandibles clicking in interest. Such fine beasts, and all of them yours to claim!\\n\\nIt takes but a little pressure to bend them to your whims. To the pens of Karond Kar they go, a glorious addition to your endless throng of beasts.
There is surely no better field test for the War Machines of the Dawi than a Slayer’s path to doom!\\n\\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_malakai_adventures_mission_complete_description_2}}

You have gathered enough Souls to gain two Rift Sigils!\\n\\nBy accessing the Chaos Rift that has opened in your home province, you may use the sigil to start your teleportation network that shall lead you to Zanbaijin.
You have gathered enough Souls to gain another two Rift Sigils!\\n\\nContinue gathering Souls to obtain more sigils and finish your teleportation network to Zanbaijin.
You have gathered enough Souls to gain the final three Rift Sigils!\\n\\nClaim the final rifts to complete your teleportation network that shall lead you to the final battle at Zanbaijin.
This Mortal has ascended, taking on a new and monstrous appearance. But they will need time and experience to adapt to their new form fully.

Archaon the Everchosen is dead and the Altar of Battle lies in pieces, while the Prince of Pleasure basks in the delight of his champion's victory and indulges in a banquet of souls. Azazel simply preens. As if such an outcome was ever in doubt? Truly, his victory was all but assured, for who could ever hope to match his greatness?\\n\\nNow leaving the Arena of Battle behind as its final champion, Azazel can bask eternally in the gratification of his victory. Moreover, the favour he has earned in Slaanesh's eyes will surely draw countless followers to his cause. It is finally time for the Prince of Damnation to take his rightful place as his Lord's worldly right hand. He will lead His agents of decadence in dominating the mortal plane, and ensure all who once pledged themselves to Order succumb to the allure of ecstasy.

A pox on the world and all who reside in it! That is sure to be the fate of the mortal realm, for Festus the Leechlord has emerged triumphant from the Altar of Battle, and his power has never been greater. With Archaeon's attempt to usurp control of the Altar thwarted, the souls it once held have finally been unleashed. Grandfather Nurgle is sure to be pleased!\\n\\nIn return for his resounding victory, the Dark Apothecary has elevated himself not only as the eternal victor of the Arena, but as the harbinger of the world's total Ruin. Bolstered by the souls of Zanbaijin, the Plague Lord's influence shall know no bounds. As the armies of decay descend upon the unready, Festus shall be at the forefront, leading them against the forces of Order, and spreading his vile infections far and wide.

The remnants of the Altar of Battle lie shattered and broken, the whirling maelstrom of souls it once contained now a monumental feast for the Lord of Skulls, an unmatched supplement to his power. Valkia the Bloody has proven herself the most worthy of champions, showered in eternal glory as the last and greatest victor of Zanbaijin. With Archaon the Everchosen defeated at her hand, none could ever doubt her power now!\\n\\nYet the conquest is only just beginning. Now bearing the Blood God's banner as the most mighty of His chosen, the servants of Khorne flock to follow in the Gorequeen's footsteps. As part of her armies, they will overrun the mortal plane, an endless scourge of blood and murder across the land. For under Valkia's leadership, they cannot fail, and the world itself will surely bow before her!

The dust settles in Zanbaijin, and Vilitch has emerged as Tzeentch's champion. Having freed the tumult of souls that once remained sealed within the Altar of Battle, the God of Magic revels in the surge of power they provide. At last, His dominance among the Gods is assured!\\n\\nThe fate of Vilitch, once withered and weak, has yet again been irrevocably altered. How far he has come from such pitiable origins, for now he stands second only to his God, the leader of his Daemonic host on the mortal plane. His hunger for power however, will never truly be sated. Instead, he shall continue to scour the lands of men, gleefully unleashing the arcane power of Tzeeneth in his quest to bring the whole world to Ruin.
This army's Winds of Magic is ours! Let us make better use of it than them... for the Great Schemer.
The Winds of Magic have been drained from our army! {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:PrimaryTargetFactionContext.Name}} plans to use it against us!
This army has succumbed to Tzeentch's unexplainable ways. Now they are vulnerable!
Our army has been inhibited! {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:PrimaryTargetFactionContext.Name}} has manipulated us to no end, and we are now vulnerable to attack.
Ha! Their army finds themselves alongside the spawn of Tzeentch himself. A jape that even he would be proud of.
Our army suddenly finds themselves fighting alongside the spawn of Tzeentch himself! Surely a jest of {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:PrimaryTargetFactionContext.Name}}!

[[i]]The skies above the Altar of Battle broil in a storm of magic; a portent of power for which Chaos thirsts. A beacon for the final conflict![[/i]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]The path to Zanbaijin has been revealed. Use your network of Chaos Rifts to reach the Altar of Battle and claim your place as the Champion of Chaos![[/col]]

[[i]]Zanbaijin’s final Champion shall claim the Altar of Battle and herald one Chaos God’s supremacy over the world. First, their Master’s gaze must be turned…[[/i]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]To reveal the way to the final battle at Zanbaijin, a network of Chaos Rifts must first be created.[[/col]]\\n\\n[[col:green]]Chaos Rifts open as you collect enough [[img:icon_souls_resource]][[/img]]Souls to grant you the required sigils.[[/col]]

[[i]]The Ice Queen has resurrected the dying god; Ursun returns to the Kislevite pantheon. The world is healing but remains wounded – rifts still scar the landscape, although they are dormant for now.[[/i]]

The so-called Lord of Underearth holds no power in the Dark Lands! The Brazier of Gazul holds energy, however. That much cannot be denied. Bound to Daemonic powers and channelled into the Great Drill, your progress toward the Dark God's fiery realm will surely increase tenfold, bringing you ever closer to the Blood of Hashut!

Nothing puts the lie to the Ancestors' power like parading their relics through the beating heart of Zharr-Naggrund. Such a display of superiority is sure to impress the Conclave of Evil. They no doubt watch from the Temple of Hashut, as this relic of Gazul is marched through the streets and all gather to revel in your conquest.

Your Daemonsmiths toil over wretched Grimnir's relic, binding the artefact to a Daemon and despoiling its energies with the potent corruption of Chaos. The Dawi's 'fearless warrior-god' will now serve to power the Great Drill, churning reality until Hashut's realm is finally within reach!

The Dawi's pathetic warrior-god was nowhere to be seen when your forces crushed theirs, and nor did Grimnir strike the Dawi-Zharr down as they claimed his relic for Zharr-Naggrund. This puny Ancestor is clearly worth nothing! As proof, let his tarnished Golden Bands be paraded through the acrid smoke of your homeland, a trophy to the slaughter of your long-abandoned kin.

Bound with Daemonic energy, the Ever-Burning Helmet of Grungni now simmers with corruption. It seems fitting that the false God of Mining and Stonemasonry will power the Great Drill, fuelling its violent churning of the earth. Soon Hashut's molten realm shall be revealed, and the Ruinous magma that flows there will ensure the supremacy of the Uzkul-Dhrath-Zharr!

The Ever-Burning Helmet is paraded before the masses of Zharr-Naggrund, a shining symbol of your victory over the Dawi and the failure of their revered Ancestors. The Conclave of Evil cannot fail to recognise your strength, now that this token of Grungni's power has been thoroughly mocked and degraded by the Children of Hashut!

The ancient Focal Lens of Morgrim has been bound to Daemonic powers, corrupted beyond recognition by the most talented Daemonsmiths of Zharr-Naggrund to siphon its magic. The Great Drill of Hashut is a machine even Morgrim himself could only have dreamed of creating, proving the artificers of the Dawi-Zharr are superior even to the Ancestors themselves!

Why waste such an ancient and powerful relic when the Dawi-Zharr could wield its power instead? The Focal Lens of Morgrim will prove a boon to the engineers of our infernal empire, spurring them to produce the greatest war machines  known to any realm.\\n\\nNo wonder the crowds cheer as the relic is flaunted through the streets! One can only imagine the bloody carnage such dark engines will wreak...

Despoiled and disfigured by Daemonic binding, your Daemonsmiths have rendered the Runic Bracers of Skavor to be no more than mere fragments of Chaos. Through the efforts of sorcery and hellish science, they have been made one with the Great Drill of Hashut for eternity.\\n\\nMay their power fuel our drill, as it carves a path to the magma our Sorcerers desperately crave!

None can doubt your power when such a beacon of might and superiority is worn so proudly before the masses! Plucked from amongst the broken bodies of your foes, the Runic Bracers of Skavor will serve as a stark reminder of Dawi-Zharr dominance. Your enemies would surely weep... were they still alive to see it!

Daemon, hammer and drill are bound as one by the expert hands of the Hell-Workers. Whatever power this relic of the false-god Smednir once possessed, it has no doubt been multiplied by the endless energies of Chaos. Once the drilling commences, reality itself will be warped by its power, and core of the earth shall finally open to us!

The Conclave of Evil are no doubt impressed by your victory. How could they deny it, when the Hammer of Smednir is now wielded by the Dawi-Zharr? It is a testament to the strength and glory of the infernal empire, and a signal to all other races: the Children of Hashut care not for the whims of lesser gods, for fire and Chaos reign supreme!

The blazing core of the world awaits! With the Runic Tablet of Thungni powering the Great Drill, the Dawi-Zharr are one step closer to breaking through the planes of reality and into the heart of mighty Hashut's abode. Your Sorcerer-Prophets are beside themselves at the thought all the magma they may find, and the arcane evils that will no doubt ensue!

The Great Drill can wait! More important is the image of superiority you'll project when this long-lost talisman of the Dawi is on display before your peers. This is proof of your military domination! The upper echelons of the empire will have to take note, now your decimation of those weak-willed enemies of Chaos is clear to all. Moreover, our Daemonsmiths will surely find a way to put this tablet to good use.

There is a certain satisfaction to having the Healing Salve of Valaya so utterly tainted by Daemonic corruption. Imbued with the forces of Chaos and attached to the Great Drill, its power is undeniable. Soon it will reach down into molten rock and bring back the potent Blood of Hashut!

The enchanted Healing Salve is greeted by baying crowds and malevolent laughter in Zharr-Naggrund. Ripping such an ancient and esteemed relic from the hands of those weak-willed Dawi is surely a feat worth celebrating – particularly, a relic tied to their revered Valaya. They didn't have the strength to stop us, and now their precious artefact is on display – a symbol of their abject failure!
You have discovered a convoy belonging to the Chaos Dwarfs on your lands. Their arrival has brought great riches!
After a successful journey conducting business beyond the reaches of Zharr-Naggrund, the trade Convoy has finally returned with riches and reward in tow. Now comes the time to revel in its profits!

A string of Caravans have been spotted brazenly making their way through our lands. Though their origin is yet undetermined, one thing is clear; this Convoy does not belong to the Dawi-Zharr. Whoever they are, they certainly have a lot of nerve!

A shift in supply and demand for industrial commodities in the world has resulted in new Convoy contracts arising.\\n\\nIncoming and Outgoing options for Convoy destinations have now changed and will do so every 10 turns.

How fickle the Ogres are! Once offering their protection, the same group of Ogre mercenaries now ravage your Convoy in retaliation for your refusal; it seems they do not take rejection well. Clearly, there is only one way to put a stop to this indignity!

The battle is done, but it seems the cargo is not yet free for the taking. Another Daemon seems to have taken issue with you slaughtering his kin. A very large, very angry Daemon… One can only hope this cargo is worth it!

Your Convoy returns bearing a worthy bounty, exchanged for the sweat of your empire's brow and the valuable products of its toil. One particular artefact catches the eye; perhaps it could be useful in the pursuit of your malevolent cause?

Your Convoy has returned from the perilous Bay of Blades, where the Norscan tribes of Skaeling and Sarl settle their grievances in blood. No blood was spilled this time, however, and your trading party did not return empty-handed!

Your Convoy’s assignees relished the march to "Karak Drazh", the city once lost by the western Dwarfs’ craven antecedents. Now a symbol of Dwari-Thagi weakness, Black Crag provides an added delight with your returning Convoy's cargo; an arcane token of goodwill.

The imposing halls of Castle Drakenhof are well known for hiding all manner of sorcerous relics and items of the occult. Your Convoy has returned from its towering peaks with one such intriguing artefact, destined for use in Zharr-Naggrund.

The most lucrative trade route this side of Cathay offers great profit for those strong enough to endure its dangers. Your Convoy Master has not only proven himself up to the task, but also returns with a powerful item from the mercenaries of the Ivory Road.

Traversing the Northern Grey Mountains is no easy feat, yet the hardy traders of your Convoy never faltered. Having successfully completed their dealings in Grung Zint, they return to our lands with a reward more than worthy of their treacherous journey.

Your Convoy’s trip to Karond Kar’s vast Labourer markets on the other side of the world has elevated your status as an industrial superpower, but also provides an arcane boon. Amongst your returning Convoy’s goods is a magical artefact steeped in the powers of the Land of Chill.

The visit to the Crystal Spires has brought a most promising bounty! From the great and terrible Realm of Chaos, your Convoy has returned bearing a powerful object, steeped in the glorious energies of corruption.

The Haunted Forest holds no horrors for the Dawi-Zharr! Instead, the products of our empire's tireless labour have bought a unique prize from among those whispering trees. Perhaps it will be of benefit to Zharr-Naggrund, or perhaps, of benefit to you alone…

On their return from the Palace of Ruin in the desolate plains of the Chaos Wastes, your Convoy has brought a particular item of note to your attention. Returning with such an item is proof, they say, of their expedition's worth to the Dark Lands.

Your Convoy has returned from the Chaos Wastes with an impressive haul to show for their troubles. The Silvered Tower of Sorcerers had much to barter with, including a particularly powerful artefact your Overseer is certain you'll put to good use.

After their journey through the Eastern Steppes, your trading Convoys have finally returned, greeted by the smoke and noxious fumes of Zharr-Naggrund. They bring with them the offerings of the Volary, including one specific relic that was declared to be quite the rarity.

Your Convoy has returned from Titan's Notch, bringing before you an item of particular splendour. It's valuable, if your Overseer is to be believed, and possibly the key to fuelling the expansion of our dark, industrious empire! Of course, he has been known to exaggerate.

Descending from the perilous Vanaheim Mountains, your Convoy carries a trove of wealth for their efforts. Your Overseer declares one particular commodity quite priceless; a boon to all Uzkul-Dhrath-Zharr. The visit to the Troll Fjord may have proven worthwhile indeed!

It is said that there is little about the art of sorcery that the one known as the Wizard Caliph does not know. Avoiding the curses of his palace, your Convoy returns from Araby unscathed and successful in its dealings, with a treasure of the Caliph among its goods.

Convoy routes out of the Dark Lands are now available for use in the [[col:yellow]]Military Convoys[[/col]] panel. Such enterprise may help fuel your industry, but opportunity does not come without risk.

The network of watchtowers that encircle Zharr-Naggrund report a small humanoid approaching from the west. Thinking it one of our cousins, we scramble to meet it, only to find that the curious creature has no beard and speaks a crude dialect that we Dawi-Zharr barely understand! Deciphering enough to get the gist of the matter, it would seem that the visitor is offering a bewildering array of food the likes of which are seldom seen here in the Dark Lands. Merrily, it continues on its way...

Hashut's work is surely done! After a long, hot night spent pouring over the grimoires and white-hot forges in the lava fields – and, naturally, the necessary (and exceedingly bloody) execution of more than one Greenskin Labourer – one of our Daemonsmiths has discovered a new blend of gunpowder to improve our ammunition... make everything go with a bang, you might say! Well, mainly just the enemy, if all goes to plan...

It is clear now to all that our actions have pleased our dark master, the Bull-God Hashut, the Father of Darkness to whom all Dawi-Zharr pledge their every waking breath to serve. All within the Conclave of Evil know this to be the truth, and dare not challenge the signs, so our faction has gained significant influence within the echelons of power that rule over these grim Dark Lands.

Although absolutely a good thing and far from being a matter of concern, reports from our commanders in the field tell us that Chaos Dwarf forces are showing even greater levels of aggression and heartless cruelty than even they can usually manage, desiring nothing more than to come face to face with the enemy at every opportunity, in an explosion of bloody violence! Hashut be praised – his blood shall flow across the Dark Lands, slaughtering the foe in sacrifice to the Father of Darkness!

You'd never have thought it – a Goblin Labourer with enough brains and gumption to attempt insurrection? In a rare display of true cunning, a despicable, treacherous Goblin has led his hapless Greenskin companions in a minor revolt against their rightful masters. Naturally, it will have to be put down with extreme prejudice, followed by the obligatory gory public executions, of course, but who would want it any other way?

One of our mines has recently run dry of Hashut's Blood, but we currently lack the capacity to transfer the pathetic Greenskin Labourers who worked the seam elsewhere. Clearly, there is nothing to be done but send them to the front, to die in battle against those who stand against the Chaos Dwarfs. Though I do not doubt that the regulars will complain, stentorian yelling and harsh punishments should ensure harmony is restored by the time the Greenskins are led onto the battlefield to face the foe – and most probably their own gory deaths!

In service of Hashut, Father of Darkness, and in his bloody name, the Daemonsmiths have long been the progenitors of sorcerous and mechanical innovation within Dawi-Zharr society. Due to a recent breakthrough when applying the Lore of Hashut to their work, significant advances have now been made, for the good of all. This, in turn, has lead to a dramatic increase in productivity, making it possible for us to equip our warriors at a record pace!

During the endless search for the Blood of Hashut, on the instructions of the Conclave, our mining drills have been driven even further into the ground than ever before, cracking the earth and breaking through to a rich seam of molten lava – the very Blood of Hashut! Now, the blazing torrent of molten lava spills onto the surface like a glorious river of gold. Praise be to the Father of Darkness – hallowed be his unholy name!

On nine separate occasions, sentries from every corner of our great Dawi-Zharr empire have reported seeing a powerful Sorcerer who told them that inescapable change is coming. While the troops in question all give wildly different physical descriptions of the mysterious magic-user, their reports of his words are near identical. Something is coming... and we must be ready to exploit the situation immediately, and to our best advantage!

A particularly efficacious type of coal has been burned in the furnaces of late. Usefully, the smoke this has produced burns the flesh of any who walk through it, which has got the cruel, cunning brains of the Dawi-Zharr working even faster than is usual. Though we Chaos Dwarfs are naturally unfazed by such things, due to being of the hardiest Dwarfen stock of all, our foes will not be so fortunate, which shall be a pleasure to behold!

The naturally superior road and rail systems of the Chaos Dwarf Empire are unparalleled anywhere in the Old World – better even than the technical advances achieved by those soft, weak Empire men to the west, so it would appear. Preeminent Dawi organisational skills will of course mean we can use the network to move our armies and Labour Convoys faster and further around our territory, to the continual advancement of Hashut's blessed children!

Your command over the [[col:yellow]]Tower of Zharr Grand Reaper Seat[[/col]] has granted the following boon this turn:\\n\\n[[img:unit_capacity]][[/img]][[col:green]]+1 Unit Capacity for Lammasu[[/col]]

A seat you controlled in the [[col:yellow]]Tower of Zharr[[/col]] has been usurped by the [[img:chd_astragoth]][[/img]][[col:yellow]]Disciples of Hashut[[/col]]! Such perfidy should not go unanswered!

A seat you controlled in the [[col:yellow]]Tower of Zharr[[/col]] has been usurped by the [[img:chd_drazhoath]][[/img]][[col:yellow]]The Legion of Azgorh[[/col]]! Such perfidy should not go unanswered!
A seat you controlled in the [[col:yellow]]Tower of Zharr[[/col]] has been usurped by the [[img:chd_zhatan]][[/img]][[col:yellow]]Warhost of Zharr[[/col]]! Such perfidy should not go unanswered!

You have usurped a [[col:yellow]]Tower of Zharr[[/col]] seat from the [[img:chd_astragoth]][[/img]][[col:yellow]]Disciples of Hashut[[/col]]. \\n\\n[[img:icon_diplomacy]][[/img]][[col:red]]Diplomatic relations: -10 with Disciples of Hashut for [[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]5 turns.[[/col]]

You have usurped a [[col:yellow]]Tower of Zharr[[/col]] seat from the [[img:chd_drazhoath]][[/img]][[col:yellow]]The Legion of Azgorh[[/col]]. \\n\\n[[img:icon_diplomacy]][[/img]][[col:red]]Diplomatic relations: -10 with The Legion of Azgorh for [[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]5 turns.[[/col]]

You have usurped a [[col:yellow]]Tower of Zharr[[/col]] seat from the [[img:chd_zhatan]][[/img]][[col:yellow]]Warhost of Zharr[[/col]]. \\n\\n[[img:icon_diplomacy]][[/img]][[col:red]]Diplomatic relations: -10 with Warhost of Zharr for [[img:icon_turns]][[/img]]5 turns.[[/col]]

Within the [[col:yellow]]Tower of Zharr[[/col]] Chaos Dwarf Sorcerer Lords vie for power and domination, competing to claim seats on the Conclave of Evil. Open the [[col:yellow]]Tower of Zharr[[/col]] to claim this power and become the preeminent Faction in the eyes of Hashut!
A new tier of seats is available to be claimed in the [[col:yellow]]Tower of Zharr[[/col]].
A new tier of seats is available to be claimed in the [[col:yellow]]Tower of Zharr[[/col]].

The Conclave tier of seats is available to be claimed in the [[col:yellow]]Tower of Zharr[[/col]]. Claim these seats quickly to force confederation of your rivals and claim dominion over Zharr-Naggrund!
[[col:yellow]]Your rivals, the [[img:chd_astragoth]][[/img]]Disciples of Hashut have claimed a Tower of Zharr seat![[/col]]
[[col:yellow]]Your rival, the [[img:chd_drazhoath]][[/img]]The Legion of Azgorh has claimed a Tower of Zharr seat![[/col]]
[[col:yellow]]Your rival, the [[img:chd_zhatan]][[/img]]Warhost of Zharr has claimed a Tower of Zharr seat![[/col]]

The Dark Father's will is made manifest; his servants must unite to exterminate the weakling races of the world, to exploit their meagre resources and to expand the borders of the Dark Lands. Zealous and cruel, the lords of Zharr-Naggrund seize their opportunity to dominate the world. This destructive march of Chaos Dwarf industry must be stopped before it leads to ruination for all!
Dark energies manifest atop the spires of Zharr-Naggrund, and the Chaos Dwarfs gather to answer the call of Hashut...

It is only right that the High Priest of Hashut be the one to embrace the Father of Darkness' hellish abode. There the Blood of Hashut runs like molten fire, flowing everywhere in abundance. Such stores of magma will never run dry; a limitless supply of arcane power!\\n\\nWithered and weak no more, this wealth of sorcerous energy will surely grant you power like never before. The greatest Sorcerer-Prophet to ever live will reign in perpetuity!

This is it! The great victory that will finally prove to all the worth of Drazhoath the Ashen, and perhaps bring these years of agonising exile ever closer to an end. The Blood of Hashut is yours to control, a near endless source of power for the arcane arts. None can question you now, not when the terrible glory of Hashut's realm has been revealed to you alone!

Hashut's realm of darkness and flame has been breached, where his Blood runs freely in scorching rivers of fire. Soon all will know that Zhatan the Black, Commander of the Tower of Zharr, was the one to receive this twisted blessing.\\n\\nWith this power at your fingertips, none could ever hope to stop you. A reign of tyranny awaits, and delicious cruelties beyond imagining!

Down among the black smoke and searing heat of the Hell-Forge, where Hashut's grim, unholy work is done, the Daemonsmiths and Sorcerer-Prophets of Zharr-Naggrund have made exciting new advances. Increasing their skills in both sorcery and engineering has led the Dark Father's children to the following advantageous developments, that will no doubt put them even further ahead of the pathetic machinations of their foes.

Due to a shortage of Armaments in the Hell-Forge, certain Manufactory upgrades have been deactivated.\\n\\nAny effects granted by the affected upgrades will be inactive until your Armaments supply is sufficient to cover the required Hell-Forge upkeep.

Ulrika’s destruction is the only thing that will balance the scales of justice. However, as crafty as ever, she broke free of her bonds and escaped into the night's cloak of frozen darkness. Though the people's righteous thirst for retribution was not to be sated this day, they were at least happy that the Vampire's execution was ordered. \\n\\n Now, however, Ulrika Magdova roams the land freely once more. Though she may be encountered again, if she will work for or against us remains to be seen.

Clearly, though Ulrika and Gabriella are no friends of the Ruinous Powers, they cannot be allowed to act of their own accord. Ulrika will not return to Nachthafen Castle, but will instead continue her training in our service. While many are unhappy with this decision, perhaps she will find redemption through fighting our enemies or peace in a noble death? \\n\\n Ulrika Magdova has been recruited!

[[fragment:3600|60]][[i]]The Launch Site is made ready at a speed so furious it becomes a mass graveyard for hundreds of exhausted workers; expendable lives, for only the drill is of concern.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[fragment:8000|60]][[i]]The remaining construction must be imbued with dark sorcery, for the Blood of Hashut lies, not only in the darkest depths of the world, but in a godly domain where no mortal engine can reach it.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[fragment:3000|60]][[i]]Four Dwarf relics are required, each to be corrupted in the forges of the Daemonsmiths. [[fragment:2500|60]]Only then shall the drill summon power enough to shatter solid rock and the foundations of reality itself.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[fragment:1500|60]][[i]]As the abhorrent relics lie undiscovered, a sacrifice must be undertaken to gain Hashut's blessing and reveal their locations.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[fragment:7000|60]][[col:green]]To access the endless supply of Hashut's blood, you must complete the Great Drill of Hashut to bore directly into His domain.[[/col]]

[[fragment:1000|60]][[i]]Relics hold great power, yet such strength will not wake in the hands of the Chaos Dwarfs, and so the Daemonsmiths must corrupt the artefacts, turning them into weapons worthy of Zharr-Naggrund![[/i]]\\n\\n[[fragment:10000|60]][[i]]Such potent magic takes a hideous toll on those who wield its might. [[fragment:3000|60]]The halls of Zharr-Naggrund are lined with the frozen forms of past Sorcerers, their statues standing in mute testament to the curse of petrification – the blight of all Chaos Dwarf Sorcerers.[[/i]]

[[fragment:2000|60]][[i]]When a single bead of Hashut’s Blood drips upon the relic, a deadly broth begins to boil as if in rage, the liquid doubling in volume.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[fragment:6500|60]][[i]]Determined to turn this unholy reaction to their own advantage, a coven of Daemonsmiths start to experiment with the infernal mercury...[[/i]]

[[fragment:2500|60]][[i]]The cunning and cruelty of Daemonsmiths, is equally matched by a voracious greed for knowledge.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[fragment:4500|60]][[i]]Further experiments reveal the blood of captive Dwarfs thickening – a physical toll of their masters’ dark sorcery. [[fragment:3500|60]]This petrification by proxy is seized on by the coven as a chance to escape the awful curse that hangs over their tribe.[[/i]]

[[fragment:2000|60]][[i]]The Daemonsmiths refine their dark recipe to an astounding conclusion. [[fragment:4000|60]]A Sorcerer may practice his infernal power without suffering the effects of petrification, transposing the affliction to enemies through a Daemonic blood pact.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[fragment:5500|60]][[i]]At last, the long-feared curse has been circumvented, freed from their shackles, the Chaos Dwarf Sorcerers can indulge without penalty.[[/i]]

[[fragment:6000|60]][[i]]The Hell-workers labour to bind a Daemon to the first Dwarf relic, despoiling it completely, before placing it into boilers of the Great Drill of Hashut.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[fragment:7300|60]][[i]]Such desecration will be remembered by the Dwarfs of the west, yet it was they that cast the first stone. [[fragment:3800|60]]It was their Ancestor Gods who abandoned the forefathers of the Dawi-Zharr as they ventured eastward into the Dark Lands.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[fragment:2800|60]][[i]]All Dwarfs can bear grudges, and those in the west shall never be forgiven![[/i]]

[[fragment:3500|60]][[i]]A second relic bound with a Daemon to power the furnaces of the Colossal Drill. [[/i]][[fragment:2000|60]][[i]]Yet, unknown to the Daemonsmiths, the hidden runes of the artefact pull the beards of Dwarfs hundreds of leagues away.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[fragment:11500|60]][[i]]Word spreads across the Karaz Ankor on its way to Everpeak. One clan, eager to enact vengeance, musters its warriors.[[/i]]

[[fragment:3000|60]][[i]]The third Daemon lends brutal strength to the engines of the drill.[[/i]] [[fragment:1500|60]][[i]]Yet, as this vile spirit writhes in the final throes of freedom, it spits out a message of mockery.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[fragment:5000|60]][[i]]This bitter prophecy forecasts the union of the Mountain Realms; that a mighty army amasses to right the grudge that burns on the pages of the Dammaz Kron, for the desecration of their holy relics.[[/i]]

[[fragment:4000|60]][[i]]With the fourth relic Daemon-bound, the Great Drill has the power to breach Hashut’s Domain. The mighty construct begins to thrum and quiver, shaking the ground as it prepares to launch its fearsome assault.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[fragment:7000|60]][[i]]Yet beyond the Ash Ridge Mountains, the ground shakes in ominous echo, for a vast alliance marches under the banner of High King Thorgrim Grudgebearer.[[fragment:5000|60]] The grudge of all grudges shall be settled![[/i]]

[[fragment:2000|60]][[i]]Captured in battle, the western kin are slaughtered one by one, and offered as sacrifice to Hashut, the Father of Darkness.[[/i]]\\n\\n[[fragment:4500|60]][[i]]The Great Bull God is pleased with the savage offerings and reveals the locations of eight Dwarfen relics.[[/i]]

Proving beyond all doubt that they are favoured by the Gods, {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetFactionName}} has enforced its will over nearly an entire continent. We should ensure that either relations are friendly or our forces are ready and able to crush them.

Following a string of impressive victories, {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetFactionName}} has become a major power. It is imperative for us to make plans to deal with them, either with overwhelming military force or cunning diplomacy.
The garrison stationed in {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}} has taken the field as a reserve force!

Within your lands, one rule holds true: trespassers deserve no mercy! The Hex of the [[col:yellow]]Coven's Cursemark[[/col]] has already found its target, sapping them of energy until every movement is a struggle. They will not run far, should you decide to hunt them down…

A dark curse has befallen your army, afflicting your soldiers with a paralysing lethargy. Trespassing in foreign lands is never without risk, but none could have anticipated the threat of such a dark and twisted Hex!

There one moment and gone the next, a whole army has disappeared into the ether, swept up in the [[col:yellow]]Jinxed Land[[/col]] Hex and deposited into the dark. The Magical Forest shall be there to greet them, once their eyes have adjusted to the gloom.

A sudden wave of magic has swept over your army, whisking them into a dark and forbidding forest, where curious eyes seem to peer out from every shadow. Such a Hex could only be the work of a powerful witch indeed…

An army of darkness descends on your enemies! With their settlement under constant assault by the bloodthirsty spirits summoned by your [[col:yellow]]Recreant Spirit[[/col]] Hex, it is only a matter of time before they crumble.

Dark spirits haunt your every step, eager to have you join their ranks and drag you into death beside them. Driven by some kind of wicked curse, they march ceaselessly on your settlement, hungering for blood. One can only hope this Dark Magic will soon wane!

The weak are so easily broken! Like puppets, your enemies fall to the [[col:yellow]]Bewitching Lure[[/col]], dancing to whatever tune you command of them. With your new thralls siphoning gold from their own settlements, your riches will soon know no bounds!

A treacherous Hag has beguiled your people, bewitching those of weak mind to her will. As gold leeches from your coffers at an alarming rate, it would seem that her newfound thralls are quietly offering her your income!

The words of the [[col:yellow]]Purification Chant[[/col]] echo across the land, burning all traces of corruption from the soil. No longer shall wickedness taint the earth here – the balance of nature has been restored.

You have discovered a new [[col:yellow]]Trinket[[/col]]! Combine it with another in the Witch's Hut to create an [[col:yellow]]Incantation[[/col]] to bless your units or curse the enemy on the battlefield.
Machinations stemming from {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}} has led to an explosion of Tzeentchian corruption in the area!
The Changer of Ways has struck - machinations stemming from {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}} has led to an explosion of Tzeentchian corruption in the area!

A rift to the Realm of Chaos opened for a brief moment within {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}}, giving a host of hostile Daemons time to pour through! Our settlement is at risk from this newly emerged threat. This must be the work of that accursed scheming Trickster: the Changeling!

Your cultists within {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}} have opened a rift to the Realm of Chaos, giving passage to a host of menacing Daemons! The rampaging horde have destroyed the rift, and now turn their Daemonic gaze upon {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetFactionName}}.

We have discovered a Trickster Cult of the Changeling within {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}}! We must act fast and spend the required amount to destroy it before it becomes more than a mere nuisance!

Overexpansion of your Trickster Cult in {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}} has led to it being discovered by {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetFactionName}}! They may now decide to allocate funds to ensure its utter destruction!

A cult of the Changeling has revealed itself within {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}}, calling forth an army of Daemons and Warriors of Chaos! Their exact scheme is unclear, but they could assault your settlement at any moment. You must be ready for anything from the devious Trickster!

Your cultists within {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}} have rallied a great host of both and Daemons and mortals outside the settlement. Your agents responsible for this deed are no more, but instead a grand army is ready to do your bidding.
A new Trickster Cult has been established in {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}}! Your cultists have successfully infiltrated the settlement and are ready to enact your devious schemes.

Your settlement in {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}} has been raided from within! The nefarious agents of the Changeling somehow infiltrated the region and have made off with much of the region's wealth.

Your cultists within {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}} have emerged from hiding, raiding the region's spoils for your ever-growing war chest! This will surely anger {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetFactionName}}, but that's no concern of yours!

After performing an action through Matters of State, your expended [[col:yellow]]Steel[[/col]] and [[col:yellow]]Stone[[/col]] have converted to the opposing alignment and will become available in due time.
Yuan Bo, the Jade Dragon has performed an action targeting one of our forces led by {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}}. Whether this speaks ill or well remains to be seen.
Yuan Bo, the Jade dragon has performed an action targeting our settlement in {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}}. Whether this speaks ill or well remains to be seen.

Interlopers have struck at one of your Astromantic Relays in {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}}, interrupting the ritual. You will have to construct a relay again if you wish to succeed, but be wary, for the adherents of the great plan are sure to be wiser to your actions.
The work is done. Consider the creations placed before you and how best they may be used.

Trespassing upon a Witch's land is a dangerous game. When the Daughters of the Forest wail in unison, they sear onto the flesh of interlopers a sinister mark that turns the very magic of the world against them. The Coven's Cursemark ensures one thing for its target: despair.

The world’s Magical Forests call to the Daughters, revealing gateways long since hidden to the uninitiated. No matter the distance or what lies between, the Coven can traverse their secret ingresses in the blink of an eye.

Those foolish enough to strike a deal with a Hag find that death is merely the beginning of an unending serfdom. The power to call upon these restless spirits has been found; a Hex to haunt unknowing foes now in the Coven’s hands.
Fickle minds are always susceptible to the whims of an alluring charm from a befouling Hag. Witchcraft is but one of many ways to sway them, a Bewitching Lure to exploit those weak of will.
There are places where the Coven’s magic seeps from the land, befouled by the blight of corruption. The Daughters answer with a purifying chant to purge the rot, at least for a time.

The five forbidden Hexes have been assembled, each piece a scattered fragment of a grand and sinister whole. Together they reveal a most baleful Hex, capable of bringing calamity to an entire race. They call it the "Malediction of Ruin".

The Black Pyramid ascends from the sand-swept deserts, casting down a looming shadow of death as it glides through the skies. The dark monument’s descent spells Ruin for its next unfortunate destination, its Undead hosts eager to emerge to greet their new neighbours…

A nightmarish Blood Knight has plagued Bretonnia for years, but a certain Trickster’s meddling sees new Vampiric thralls arise under his command to threaten the population. Now stronger than ever, the Red Duke leaves naught but death in his wake. May the Lady fall to his unending wrath…

The Changeling has little interest in the Great Game, but opportunity presents a fitting backdrop for a rendezvous most bloody. Thus Tzeentch sees it fit to unleash hordes of Daemonic thralls against those who oppose him – and what a sight it is to behold.

Freed from the shackles of servitude to uncaring masters, swathes of Labourers sweep through the Dark Lands in a rebellious frenzy. Years of pent-up fury has started to erupt; the Changeling’s scheme now unfolding in anarchy and uprising.

Not even the walled lands of Cathay can withstand the relentless meddling of Tzeentch’s Trickster. The Great Bastion has been breached by a mere scurrying rat, as warbands and followers of Tzeentch advance upon Cathay with Ruinous intent.

Despite Tzeentch’s endless hatred for Nurgle, the Changeling is more than happy to play with every toy within his reach. Having helped the Skaven propagate contagion throughout Lustria, the odour of decay now festers in lands long untainted. And thus, the rot of plague infects all in its path…

Masses of bloated Undead crawl out from the ocean’s depths, fixated on the Land of Chill’s bustling ports. The Changeling’s meddling has them shuffling their distended remains towards Naggaroth’s harbours with naught but blood on their withering minds.

Norscan warriors unceasingly crave the thrill of battle, many wandering for decades just to seek a worthy fight. Yet their wills are weak – easily malleable once broken by the Changeling. Thus they march upon a new target, guided by his hand…

Like a house of cards, the authority of the Empire can be a fragile thing. A simple yet dastardly scheme has ensured its lands have descended into civil war – for the Changeling, a spectacle wholly worth his engagements with the petty, bickering mortals.

Not even the Shifting Isles can protect Ulthuan from the seductive whims of those who now descend upon its shores. The Changeling’s scheming turns the gaze of Slaanesh’s thralls unto the island-haven, its settlements now a frontline against their depravities.
The Winds of Magic now flow from where the Dragon Emperor’s personnel watch over the Ivory Road. Power ebbs from a grand watchtower of jade and jet toward the great Wu Xing Compass.
Death befalls all who enter the magical waters of the Dragon River uninvited. But as the Winds of Magic flow in Cathayan favour, its ill-effects can be harnessed for far more than merely death alone…
The Winds of Magic betwixt the scarred earth of the Broken Lands surge towards the Wu Xing Compass – and with them, a foreboding rush of power to the armies of the Jade Court.

The completion of this relay ensures the mighty Winds of Magic are guided in a new direction. The Nongchang Basin holds magic beneath its fertile soil. The Wu Xing Compass can now direct it for the true benefit of Cathay.

Bleeding profusely from his doppelganger-inflicted wound, Aekold stumbled into the mirror-portal. When he finally stepped back into the world he was not only healed, but forever changed. He turned to face the mirror-portal once more to see two eyes, glittering like multi-faceted gems and burning with inner balefires, staring back at him, his armour pulsating with twisting runes that glowed in the flickering darkness. Aekold lifted his sword in a challenge to humanity and all the things he had once held dear.\\n\\nAekold, son of Graf of the Reikland, is gone. A new Champion of Tzeen’neth is born!

Bleeding profusely from his doppelganger-inflicted wound, Aekold stumbled into the mirror-portal. When he finally stepped back into the world he was not only healed, but forever changed. He turned to face the mirror-portal once more to see two eyes, glittering like multi-faceted gems and burning with inner balefires, staring back at him, his armour pulsating with twisting runes that glowed in the flickering darkness. Aekold lifted his sword in a challenge to humanity and all the things he had once held dear.\\n\\nAekold, son of Graf of the Reikland, is gone. A new Champion of Tzeen’neth is born!

The Blue Scribes have begun creating a repository of madness within the library, expanding their occult collection day by day. The Architect of Fate is sure to delight in this bounteous trove of magic, for the agents of change are now free to make use of it, revelling in its power.\\n\\nWith the Blue Scribes at your side, the arcane spirit of Tzeentch is always at hand. With every parchment filled, new magics lie at your disposal, certain to make the enemies of Change quake in fear.

The Blue Scribes are eager to wreak havoc upon your enemies, reading spells at random from their scrolls until all is drowning in Chaos. Every morsel of magic let loose into the air is another scroll scribbled into being and another spell etched to life in Tzeen'neth's name.\\n\\nWith the Blue Scribes at your side, the arcane power of Tzeentch is always at hand. With every parchment filled, new magics lie at your disposal, certain to make the enemies of Change quake in fear.
Your Dwarfs in Vaul's Anvil have presented you with a new Item.

After several Grudges were settled by the might of your throng, you have now unlocked access to the [[col:yellow]]Great Book of Grudges[[/col]]!\\n\\nAccess the book to recruit Grudge Settler mercenaries and confederate other Dwarf Legendary Lords to your cause.
Through diplomacy and recompense our grudges with {{CcoCampaignEventIncident:FirstTargetName}} have been settled!
A pledge of Oathgold can now unlock the power of millennia-old Dawi secrets!\\n\\nView the [[sl:campaign_forging_magic_items_button]]Forge panel[[/sl]] for more information.

With the Sorcerer-Prophet and his Dreadquakes no longer posing a threat to our Kislevite allies, [[i]]{{tr:missions_localised_title_wh3_dlc25_mis_dwf_malakai_dreadquake_destruction_1}}[[/i]] has been completed.\\n\\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_malakai_adventures_missions_still_available}}

With the Exalted Bloodthirster struck down and Gotrek made to eat his words, [[i]]{{tr:missions_localised_title_wh3_dlc25_mis_dwf_malakai_exalted_bloodthirster_1}}[[/i]] has been completed.\\n\\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_malakai_adventures_missions_still_available}}

With the malevolent Tree Spirits put down for our grateful Empire allies, [[i]]{{tr:missions_localised_title_wh3_dlc25_mis_dwf_malakai_malevolent_tree_spirits_1}}[[/i]] has been completed.\\n\\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_malakai_adventures_missions_still_available}}

With the grobi denied a frightening ally in the Spider Matriarch once and for all, [[i]]{{tr:missions_localised_title_wh3_dlc25_mis_dwf_malakai_spider_swarm_1}}[[/i]] has been completed.\\n\\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_malakai_adventures_missions_still_available}}

With the Ancestor Tombs and wider world finally safe from the Undead horde, [[i]]{{tr:missions_localised_title_wh3_dlc25_mis_dwf_malakai_undead_empowered_1}}[[/i]] has been completed.\\n\\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_malakai_adventures_missions_still_available}}

With the Skaven bomb disarmed and their plot in ruins, [[i]]{{tr:missions_localised_title_wh3_dlc25_mis_dwf_malakai_warpstone_bomb_1}}[[/i]] has been completed.\\n\\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_malakai_adventures_missions_still_available}}
The vicious Dragon who has terrorised your kin shall soon be in your modified Cannons’ sights!\\n\\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_malakai_adventures_unlocked_adventure_battle_description}}

The notorious Sorcerer-Prophet who brazenly raids Kislev shall soon be in your modified Gyrocopters’ sights!\\n\\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_malakai_adventures_unlocked_adventure_battle_description}}

The Exalted Bloodthirster who spearheads the latest Daemonic invasion shall soon be in your modified Organ Guns’ sights!\\n\\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_malakai_adventures_unlocked_adventure_battle_description}}

The slaughterous Treemen who devastate the Old World shall soon be in your modified Flame Cannons’ sights!\\n\\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_malakai_adventures_unlocked_adventure_battle_description}}

The irksome Goblins and the Arachnarok Queen they covet shall soon be in your modified Goblin Hewer’s sights!\\n\\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_malakai_adventures_unlocked_adventure_battle_description}}

The Vampire Lord who defiles the Dwarfholds shall soon be in your modified Gyrobombers’ sights!\\n\\n{{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_malakai_adventures_unlocked_adventure_battle_description}}

The Skaven besiegers at the heart of their evil scheme shall soon be set upon by your one-of-a-kind Thunderbarges!\\n\\n {{tr:ui_text_replacements_localised_text_malakai_adventures_unlocked_adventure_battle_description}}
